1466631.title: Full Stack Developer - Python (m/w/d)
1466631.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel's global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
The position is to cover the role of Software Engineer for our industry-leading One Global System. You will be joining a global team of engineers and analysts; you will design and build products to provide innovative solutions to delight your customers. We want you to help take us to the next level!
How you create impact
You are responsible to be an active member of the team by not only the delivery of features designed by the analysts but by being creative and innovative in bringing new ideas, software and solutions to the product
You strive to deliver clean code that is focused, pleasing to read and well tested
Being responsible as part of the team that all software delivered is of the highest possible quality within the constraints imposed by time and money
Not afraid to research, learn and implement new technologies and techniques
Willing to positively challenge all team members on how the products and processes can be improved
What we would like you to bring
Provable experience in full-stack web development with Python and JavaScript - preferably experience in Django REST framework, Vue.js and Elasticsearch
Any knowledge of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Apache Spark would be useful
Thirst, willingness and ability to quickly learn new skills and technologies
Strong customer service orientation as this is the center of everything we do
Team player who cares about delivering the best that they can
Good English written and oral communication skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal and communication skills in both technical and user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated, directed, detail-oriented and result-driven personality
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, youll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. Youll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you dont tick every box, we encourage you to apply your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

1465008.title: DevOps Engineer
1465008.description:
DevOps Engineer:
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, the company has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B business. By leveraging its proprietary technology, Playtech delivers innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging and entertaining gaming experience.
As the gaming industry's leading technology company, it combines business intelligence-driven software, services, content, and platform technology to drive excellence and innovation across the sector. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com and www.playtech.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Embracing differences and maintaining transparency in our processes is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Playtech's
Infrastructure
unit is looking for a
Network DevOps Engineer
with a curious mindset and a strong sense of initiative to join our team in Estonia.
Your influential mission. You will...
Analyze, develop, and implement automated solutions for network management.
Perform testing and evaluation of new network solutions.
Collaborate with developers, engineers, and architects.
Help ensure network reliability and availability in critical environments.
Work with other teams and apply security measures according to requirements.
Document work processes and share best practices.
Components for success. You...
Have a technical background in IT.
Are proficient in working with Linux.
Possess development/scripting skills.
Are eager to learn and grow professionally.
Understand network fundamentals (load balancing, TCP IP, TLS).
Have experience working with Python.
Communicate fluently in English, both written and spoken.
You'll get extra points for...
Demonstrating previous experience in software development.
Working with virtualization tools.
Bringing experience in the networking domain.
Understanding of cloud platforms.
Bringing experience in systems analysis.
Having IT-related education.
Familiar keywords to you are...
Python
Linux
Django
Grafana
Puppet
AWS
Google Cloud
Kubernetes (Network policies / CNI; Ingress controllers)
CCNA
TCP IP
TLS
F5
CheckPoint
Thrive in a culture that values...
Initiative-taking and confident approach at the workplace.
Global scope and inclusive working environment.
Constant learning and development opportunities.
Active lifestyle and mental well-being.
Fun and engaging company events.
INFRASTRUCTURE UNIT
Our infrastructure is spread over 20 different countries and 34 data centers. We rely on 25 000 virtual machines and have 39 000 TB of storage space. Impressive? Using cutting-edge technologies, we provide central IT infrastructure service to business and internal customers worldwide.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1476586.title: Tehniline ekspert
1476586.description: Otsime tehnilist eksperti meie rahvusvahelise toe tiimi. Tiim tegeleb igapäevaselt tarkvara ja mehaanika probleemide lahendamisega, mis tulevad sisse kõikidest RVM Systems riikidest. Sulle sobib töö meie tiimis, kui sulle meeldib vaheldusrikas töö ehk oled valmis iga päev uusi probleeme lahendama. Sind iseloomustab uudishimulikkus ja sul on piisavalt kannatlikkust, et keerulisemate küsimuste puhul lahenduseni jõuda. Sa tunned end mugavalt inglise keeles suheldes, nii kõnes kui kirjas, sest suhtlemist teiste riikide spetsialistidega on palju. sõsar- ning partnerettevõtete töötajatele tehnilise toe ja konsultatsiooni pakkumine keerulisemate probleemide lahendamisel (nii tark- kui riistvaralised probleemid) uutele turgudele laienemisel piirkonnajuhtidele tehnilise sisendi andmine tehnilise seadistuse kaardistamine ja teostamine (API liidestus, võrguühendused, seadmete sobiv seadistus jms) esinenud probleemide logimine, dokumenteerimine ning arendustegevuseks sisendi andmine kolleegide ning koostööpartnerite tehniline koolitamine vajadusel lähetustel käimine IT alane haridus või vastav töökogemus kesktasemel Linux teadmised (CLI, võrgud, tõrkeotsing) baastasemel teadmised arvutivõrkudest heal tasemel eesti- ja inglise keel nii kõnes kui kirjas tugev probleemilahendamise, tõrkeotsingu ning keskendumise võime (sh logifailide lugemine ning seadistuste muutmine konfiguratsioonifailides) varasem kogemus relatsiooniliste andmebaasidega - PostgreSQL (navigeerumine, käsureal muudatuste tegemine) varasem kogemus bash scriptide koostamisel API lahenduste kasutamise ning seadistamise kogemus suurepärast kogemus rahvusvahelises, oma ala juhtivas Skandinaavia ringmajanduse ettevõttes pidevaid arenemisvõimalusi spordikompensatsiooni, ühtehoidvat tiimi ja tiimiüritusi mugavat kontorit ja häid töötingimusi kodukontori võimalust

1476374.title: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d)
1476374.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel's global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
We are seeking a talented and motivated Analytics Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, analytics, and a passion for turning data into actionable insights. Experience with Snowflake and DBT is essential, while familiarity with Python is advantageous.
How you create impact
Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines to support analytics and reporting needs.
Data Integration: Integrate data from various sources, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models to support business intelligence and analytics.
Data Analysis: Perform data analysis to derive actionable insights and support decision-making.
Collaboration: Work closely with data analysts, data architects, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
Performance Optimization: Optimize data processing and storage for performance and cost-efficiency.
What we would like you to bring
Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering, analytics, or a related role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, Snowflake, and DBT or any other data pipeline tool. Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus. Familiarity with Python and the Dagster tool is advantageous.
CI/CD: Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices and tools.
BI Tools: Experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau and SAP BusinessObjects (BO) is welcomed.
Language Skills: High level of written and spoken English is required to work effectively in an international team.
Attitude: A positive, can-do attitude and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data sets. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, you'll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You'll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics.
Even if you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

1468081.title: Data Engineer
1468081.description:
Job description::
Lead the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines and data models, primarily in Azure (incl. Snowflake) and Google Cloud.
Work closely with business stakeholders, internal IT teams, Master Data teams, and external consultants to deliver scalable, reliable data solutions.
Select and apply appropriate data engineering tools, methods, and technologies in line with architectural guidelines.
Troubleshoot data pipeline issues and enhance data quality, performance, and maintainability.
Prioritize and implement technical improvements without separate business approval, following company standards.

Requirements for candidates::
Education:
Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering, computer science, or a related field.
Data Engineering Expertise:
Practical experience building and maintaining data pipelines; strong SQL skills; data modeling experience (dimensional, Data Vault 2.0); familiarity with Agile Data Engine.
Tech Stack:
Experience with Azure, Google Cloud, or Snowflake. Proficiency in Python or a similar programming language.
Collaboration:
Strong communication and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work effectively with internal stakeholders and external partners.
Independence & Initiative:
Ability to work with high levels of autonomy, drive complex initiatives, and influence decisions.
Strategic thinking:
Courage to challenge and analyze initiatives to ensure business value.
Additional experience:
ETL processes, scripting (Python), supporting Data Science initiatives.
BI tools:
Experience with Power BI or Qlik is considered an advantage.

Company Offers::
Health and incident insurance after a 3-month probation period.
Learn from experienced colleagues across multiple countries.
Opportunity to grow your expertise within an international organization.
Annual performance bonuses.
Sports allowance.
Hybrid working model (3 days in the office, 2 days remote).
* We truly appreciate your interest in this role. We will reach out personally to those candidates who are invited to the second round.

1470137.title: Software Engineer
1470137.description:
Sisu Group is a fast-growing iGaming startup
with over
150 team members
and offices in Tallinn and Malaga.
We are on a mission to redefine the future of iGaming and sports betting by building cutting-edge technology and next-generation player experiences
-
In 2024,
ReSpin.com
and
Epicbet.com
were successfully launched.
Backed by €21M in secured funding
, the majority of our company is owned by the people building it, our team.
Sisu promotes a collaborative, non-corporate culture, offering competitive salaries with stock options to match.
We are seeking a
Software Engineer
to help us build the next generation iGaming platform. If you're looking to build something from the ground up, free from any technical debt, look no further than Sisu Group.
You'll have the exciting opportunity to
:
Design and develop software solutions to meet business needs
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse requirements
Improve the performance, scalability, and reliability of the software
Build and deploy automated, cutting-edge software that is cloud-native
What we expect:
Willingness to create new services from scratch
Interest to automate where possible
Understanding of application lifecycle and agile workflows
Strong communication and teamwork skills
Genuine interest and enthusiasm for the technologies and tools we use
What we use:
Google Cloud
Terraform (CDK)
Github
Monorepo
ArgoCD
Typescript & Node.js
PostgreSQL
React / Preact
Location:
Tallinn, working hybrid - 4 in the office and a day remote.
Company culture and benefits:
At Sisu Group we believe in creating a positive and inclusive workplace culture where teamwork is the key. We value collaboration, open communication, and treat all team members as equals. We encourage each other to be proactive and take ownership, while also providing the support and resources needed to help them grow and develop even further.
We understand that our employees are our biggest asset, which is why we offer a competitive compensation package that includes stock options, and generous paid time off. We believe that building a great company is about more than just creating a successful product, it's about building a community of passionate and driven individuals who share a common goal.
If you're looking for a company where you can grow professionally, work with talented and dedicated colleagues, and make a real impact, while sharing our key values of caring, thinking outside the box, taking charge and having a positive mindset, then Sisu Group is the place for you.
By submitting this application, the candidate agrees that Sisu Group stores personal details to be able to process the job application. Sisu Group follows and is compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation. Clear police record required, ensuring a commitment to integrity and a safe workplace.

1471768.title: Senior Cloud Engineer
1471768.description:
What do you need to succeed in the role? :
A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.
Hands-on experience working with infrastructure as code approach using Terraform.
Hands-on experience working with Azure cloud and Kubernetes.
Experience one of scripting language PowerShell, bash or Python.
Experience setting up and working with security, monitoring & alerting solutions (Azure Monitor, New Relic, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, etc.)
Familiarity with CI/CD approach for application and infrastructure deployment.
Familiarity with containerization using Docker.
Familiarity with Azure SQL database server and RDBMS principles.
Fluent written and spoken English language skills for effective communication and collaboration with our international team.
Also, nice to have:
Previous experience working in the banking or Fintech domain.
A reasonable level of competence in software development, cybersecurity, application monitoring & support.
Previous experience working with RabbitMQ or another queue system.
Experience with database and queue services: backup policy, monitoring, data migration.
Previous experience working with Kafka, PostgreSQL or MongoDB.
Previous experience working with IIS and Nginx web services.

What will be your challenge? :
Design, develop, and test secure cloud infrastructure solutions, tailored to specific requirements and business needs.
Implement new and extend existing solutions following the Infrastructure as Code (IaC) approach using Terraform and Packer.
Close involvement with implementation and maintenance of such services as Kubernetes, HashiCorp Vault and Consul, and database services using Azure SQL Server, MongoDB Atlas, RabbitMQ, etc.
Create and maintain monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and New Relic.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of Infrastructure Product.
Share and present architectural decisions to the team.
Collaborate with other teams to improve their infrastructure implementation.

What do we offer::
Inclusive and valuing culture
At Riverty, you can be who you are. We strive to create an inclusive environment and an appreciative culture, enhanced by our employee networks.
Health & Wellbeing
Your physical and mental health is important to us. Take advantage of our various preventive care and support services.
Professional and Personal Development
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities. Benefit, for example, from training courses offered by Bertelsmann University, language courses or leadership trainings
Monetary Benefits & Discounts
Know that you're appreciated with plenty of employee benefits & discounts just for you.
Flexibility
Our diverse working models empower you to customize your work to perfectly align with your preferences. Benefit from mobile office, flexible working hours and part-time models.

1465175.title: Reporting Developer
1465175.description:
Were looking for a Report Developer to turn data into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders across the NCE region. Youll build robust reporting assets, maintain reliable schedules, and ensure decision-makers can trust what they see.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design and develop high-quality Power BI dashboards and visuals.
Produce ad-hoc/manual reports for business requests with fast, accurate turnaround.
Create, maintain, and schedule recurring reports and alerts.
Monitor report pipelines/jobs, troubleshoot issues, and proactively improve reliability.
Partner with data engineering/analytics to standardize definitions and improve data
quality
REQUIREMENTS:
The successful candidate will demonstrate a high sense of responsibility and stress resistance and must have the following skills:
SQL expert, with strong experience using Python and/or R for complex queries, data prep, and statistical models.
Advanced Excel and solid data-modelling fundamentals.
Proven Power BI data visualization skills (DAX, data modeling, performance tuning).
Experience with dbt, GitHub (or similar), and an understanding of ETL/ELT best
practices.
Strong problem-solving skills. Able to simplify complexity into clear, actionable
insights.
High standards for accuracy, precision, and attention to detail.
Confident communication and presentation skills with non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent English
Competencies:
Breaks down complex problems into clear, actionable tasks.
Proactive, resourceful, and takes ownership end-to-end.
Manages multiple priorities without sacrificing quality or deadlines.
Collaborative team player who elevates shared goals and outcomes
Holds a strong quality mindset and respects deadlines
WE OFFER:
Great opportunity to take part in the development of a growth- and innovation-driven company and build its future.
Dynamic work in a rapidly growing international company with personal development possibilities.
Professional team with various international backgrounds to collaborate.
Opportunity for career development.
Wide benefits package: annual company performance bonus, extra day off on your birthday, dedicated days off for your physical and mental health, additional vacation days depending on the length of employment, health insurance policy, wellness and team-building events, dedicated budget for your training and development, paid online consultations with certified therapists and so much more!

1465176.title: QA Engineer
1465176.description:
Reach-U works with customers around the world on unique, data-driven software projects. With our purpose-built technology, our customers can perform business analysis more interactively and much faster than with other tools.
Join our team in Tartu and make a global impact!
What You'll Be Doing:
Were looking for a detail-oriented and proactive QA Engineer with a strong interest in test automation to join our QA community. Youll work closely with developers, project managers, and other stakeholders to ensure our products meet the highest standards of quality, reliability, and performance.
Your responsibilities will include:
Design, implement, and maintain test plans and test cases (manual and automated).
Execute functional, regression, integration, and exploratory tests.
Develop and maintain test automation scripts (if applicable).
Identify, document, and track defects; work closely with developers to resolve them.
Participate in sprint planning, backlog grooming, and daily standups.
Analyze test results and provide feedback on product quality.
Contributing to continuous improvement of QA processes and test automation strategy.
What You'll Bring to the Team:
2+ years of hands-on QA experience (manual and/or automation).
Strong understanding of SDLC, testing methodologies, and QA best practices.
Experience with tools such as:
Manual:
Jira, Postman
Automation:
Selenium, Cypress, Playwright etc.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins).
Knowledge of API testing (REST, GraphQL).
Good scripting skills in [JavaScript / Python / Java / etc.].
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail and analytical thinking.
Initiative to improve testing processes and product quality.
Excellent English and Estonian proficiency (written & spoken).
It would be great if you are familiar with following:
Performance testing (using JMeter, k6 or other similar tool).
Security or accessibility testing awareness (OWASP Top10, WCAG).
ISTQB FL certificate or other QA certifications.
Why Join Reach-U?
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Strong customers that trust us with the most demanding and fulfilling tasks.
One self-development day per month.
Sports or health compensation.

1466966.title: Senior Credit Risk Analyst
1466966.description:
Who we are looking for?:
We are seeking a talented Senior Credit Risk Analyst to join our growing credit risk analytics team. This role is specifically designed for professionals with minimum of 3 years of experience in the lending industry who are looking to develop their career in credit risk analytics and statistical modelling within the banking sector.
Please note:
This position is for a Senior Credit Risk Analyst role focused on credit risk assessment and modelling, not financial analysis.
About the Role
As a Senior Credit Risk Analyst, you will contribute to the development and enhancement of our credit risk analytics capabilities. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a first experience in unsecured lending to get wider exposure and larger remit (affordability and underwriting scorecards and credit strategy, pricing and credit risk management) whilst working with cutting-edge statistical models and data-driven insights.
You will have the opportunity to work in an pan-European team and get exposure to credit risk analytics across our international markets including Baltic countries, Germany, Austria and other European markets.

Key Responsibilities::
Data Analysis & Insights: Collect, analyse, and interpret data from multiple sources including internal systems and Credit Bureaus to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities that inform credit policy, credit limit and pricing strategies
Model Development: Contribute to developing and maintaining statistical models, including scorecards and other credit risk assessment tools
Stakeholder Collaboration: Provide clear, actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the business, supporting informed decision-making and business growth
Cross-functional Teamwork: Work collaboratively with colleagues in the decision sciences and analytics team, as well as other departments across different locations
Communication & Reporting: Present complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences through clear presentations, reports, and data visualisations

Essential Requirements::
Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related quantitative discipline. A Master's degree is preferred.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in analytics, data science, data analysis, or lending/credit assessment within the financial services sector.
Previous experience working for an unsecured lender (bank, fintech, or similar credit provider).
Technical Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with excellent attention to detail
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis
Understanding of statistical analysis techniques and data modelling methodologies
Experience or strong interest in predictive modelling (logistic regression knowledge would be advantageous)
Professional Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable business insights
Strong presentation skills with experience communicating to diverse audiences
Proven ability to work effectively in fast-paced environments whilst managing multiple priorities

Desirable Requirements::
Programming experience in Python or R
Experience with data visualisation tools
Understanding of machine learning techniques applied to credit risk

What we offer::
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity to work with advanced analytics and statistical modelling techniques
Professional development and training opportunities
Collaborative, inclusive working environment
Flexible working arrangements
Career progression opportunities within our growing analytics function

1462426.title: DevOps System Engineer for Application Integration (m/w/d)
1462426.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel's global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
As a DevOps Engineer for our new Application Integration platform in AWS, you will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that supports scalable and efficient application integration. Using DevOps best practices and cloud-native solutions, you will ensure that our Middleware platform operates seamlessly, aligning with our goals for reliability, scalability, and automation. Your work will enable Kuehne+Nagel application teams to easily connect with the K+N Digital ecosystem through self-service solutions, CI/CD pipelines, and AWS-based deployments. On a daily basis, you will collaborate closely with DevOps and Software Engineers to evolve our platform while ensuring that cloud-based infrastructure and services are utilized efficiently across teams, avoiding silos or isolated knowledge. As a champion of Infrastructure-as-Code and GitOps, you will integrate these practices seamlessly with our broader infrastructure, driving automation and efficiency at every level.
How you create impact
Deploy and maintain a cloud-native data integration platform in AWS (based on Cloudera DataHub, Apache Nifi) to facilitate seamless application integration.
Design and implement CI/CD pipelines to streamline deployments and ensure the consistent delivery of middleware services.
Use IaC tools like CloudFormation, AWS CDK and Terraform to automate the provisioning and configuration of AWS infrastructure for the Middleware platform.
Implement robust observability practices using tools like CloudWatch, Fluentd Grafana, OpenSearch to monitor platform health, performance, and integrations.
Enforce security best practices, including IAM policies, data encryption, and vulnerability management, to meet compliance requirements.
Proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, integration failures, and platform issues to maintain high availability.
You will take part in on-call 3rd-level support to ensure the platform remains highly available, reliable, and responsive to user needs.
Analyze and optimize AWS resources to ensure cost-efficient operations without compromising performance.
What we would like you to bring
Experience: Minimum 3-5 years in a similar role (DevOps engineer, SRE, Platform engineer) with hands-on experience in at least one major cloud provider (preferably AWS).
Technical Skills: Strong background in Linux administration, CI/CD tools (optimally GitLab, Jenkins), and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, AWS CDK).
Scripting: proficient scripting skills in Python and Bash for automating tasks.
Containerization and Orchestration: Strong experience with container tools and orchestration platforms (EKS, Kubernetes).
Solution-Oriented: Ability to build reusable solutions that serve as blueprints for future challenges, with some experience in hybrid infrastructures (cloud and on-premise).
Collaboration and Communication: Enthusiastic about working in international teams with good knowledge of English, both spoken and written.
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagels IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, youll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. Youll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you dont tick every box, we encourage you to apply - your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

1473117.description:
1oT is looking for a Tech Lead / Senior Software Engineer to join us in building connectivity solutions according to the new eSIM IoT standard.
1oT has built a platform for helping global IoT service providers manage their SIM cards and billing. The self-service based platform enables users to control and monitor SIM card sessions, switch SIM cards on/off, buy new SIMs, send SMS to the SIM, etc. Our client portfolio ranges from e-mobility to asset tracking to smart city solutions, so you will have interaction with a variety of IoT sectors and telecom companies.
eSIM team builds and maintains services that implement at 1oT the eSIM standard of GSMA.

What you'll do::
Develop large-scale services ( Java / REST / Spring / SQL )
Contribute to back-office UI ( Vue.js )
Run and maintain our services in AWS ( Terraform / Docker / Grafana )
Lead discussions on the architecture of the platform
Identify bottlenecks in technical solutions of the team
Lead implementation of technical initiatives
Prioritize security and compliance in development initiatives
Mentor junior members of the team on best practices and ways of working
Ensure that eSIM services are built according to GSMA specs
Handle external integrations via APIs

6+ years of development experience (Java / REST / Spring / SQL)
Previous experience as Senior Engineer, Solution Architect, or Tech Lead
Experience with cloud-hosted services (AWS / Azure / GCP)
Familiarity with modern UI frameworks is a huge plus
Experience with cryptography or HSM is a huge plus

Youre a good fit if you:
enjoy working as part of a team and like driving technical discussions forward
approach challenges with a problem-solver mindset and get things done
take strong ownership of your work and manage yourself well
have the curiosity and hunger to build products that don't yet exist

Comfortable with security-focused development

Readiness to take ownership of technical domains

1471521.title: Sales Manager
1471521.description:
Sales Manager Estonia
Location:
Flexible within Estonia, preferably in the Tallinn region or nearby
Reports to:
Head of Baltics
About VILPE
VILPE Oy is the leading Finnish developer and manufacturer of innovative roofing and ventilation solutions, trusted across the Nordics, Baltics, and Europe for over 50 years. Our mission is to create healthier, smarter, and more sustainable buildings through intelligent roof and ventilation technologies.
We are now expanding our operations in Estonia and looking for
a Sales Manager
to drive the growth of our VILPE Sense smart solution product family a cutting-edge system for real-time roof and humidity monitoring thats changing the way buildings are maintained and protected.
Your Key Responsibilities
Lead the sales and market development of the VILPE Sense smart solution and other VILPE products in Estonia.
Build and strengthen long-term partnerships with distributors, retailers, installers, designers, and contractors.
Identify and convert new B2B opportunities in the construction, roofing, and ventilation sectors.
Act as a technical advisor, providing product training, demonstrations, and solution support to professional partners and end users.
Promote brand awareness and represent VILPE at trade events, seminars, and key industry meetings.
Prepare and execute an annual sales action plan aligned with company strategy.
Manage customer and project information in the CRM system and deliver regular performance reports.
Continuously develop your expertise and stay up to date with industry trends and smart building technologies.
About You
Degree in business with technical experience, or engineering/technical education with B2B sales background.
Minimum 3 years of sales experience in the construction, roofing, or ventilation industry; an existing professional network is an advantage.
Passion for technology and innovation eager to learn and explain smart building solutions in a clear and engaging way.
Fluent Estonian and English; Russian language skills are an asset.
Confident in using Microsoft Office and CRM systems.
A self-driven, customer-focused, and target-oriented professional with a proactive and diplomatic approach.
What We Offer
A chance to lead the Estonian market entry for a breakthrough smart building solution.
An international, innovative working environment with supportive Nordic values.
Comprehensive onboarding and product training.
Company car or compensation for personal car use.
Modern tools and technical equipment.
Competitive monthly gross salary based on candidates skills and experience starting from €2500, plus an attractive performance-based bonus system.
Personal Qualities for Success
You are a solution-oriented and entrepreneurial sales professional who thrives on building partnerships and delivering value. You combine technical understanding with sales drive, balancing commercial goals with the needs of distributors and end users. You remain calm and determined under pressure and see challenges as opportunities to grow.
How to Apply
If you are ready to drive the success of VILPE Sense and be part of an innovative company shaping the future of smart roofing and ventilation,
send your CV and cover letter
in English to APPLY section. Contact phone during working hours +37122305950.

1473609.title: JavaScript / TypeScript Engineer (React) - Several Openings
1473609.description:
Company Description:
Evolution is a multinational business at the forefront of the online gaming industry. We have an extensive track record of number 1s and are always looking for great people to help us create the next big product hit. Our team of 1,000+ engineers operates out of 8 engineering hubs running code 24/7/365 to serve users around the world. This is run through a modern software stack supporting over 250 fully automated releases per month to our main live environment. We believe in building in-house competence and agile work processes so that we can deliver on our Engineering mission:
A flawless player experience.

Job Description:
We are searching for passionate JavaScript / TypeScript engineers to take an integral part in building a cross-platform web application used by hundreds of thousands of users worldwide on iOS, Android, and desktop platforms. Our technology stack is modern and based on TypeScript, React, Babylon.js, RxJs, HTML Canvas, and webpack.
What You'll Be Doing:
Develop full-fledged games from start to finish, ensuring high-quality performance and maintainability.
Work within a cross-functional team consisting of backend developers, frontend developers, and QA engineers, maintaining seamless communication and collaboration.
Collaborate closely with 3D designers, UI/UX designers, and Product Delivery Managers.
Cover all code with tests using Jest and ensure UI components are documented and tested in Storybook with visual regression testing.
Optimize performance and maintain high FPS for visually rich gaming experiences.
Contribute to architectural decisions and technology choices for front-end development.

Requirements:
JavaScript and TypeScript
: strong proficiency, including ESNext standards and advanced types.
Frameworks and Libraries (React or equivalents: Vue, Svelte, Angular)
: experience in developing multi-page SPA applications.
State Management (MobX or equivalents: Redux, Vuex, Pinia)
: deep understanding of centralized state management and performance optimization.
T
esting (Jest and React Testing Library or equivalents: Vitest, Mocha, Jasmine)
: experience with unit and component testing, TDD/BDD.

Problem-Solving and Communication
: excellent communication skills and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving, ensuring effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
Fluency in English
: proficient in both written and spoken English.

We will appreciate:

: experience with CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less), modular CSS (CSS Modules, PostCSS), and techniques for managing complex animations and responsive layouts.
Tooling and Configuration (Webpack, Vite, ESLint, Prettier
): experience in setting up build tools, linting, and code formatting.
3D Development (Babylon.js, Three.js)
: experience with 3D graphics, custom shaders, and performance optimization.
Application Architecture
: knowledge of design patterns, system modularization, and SOLID Principles.
Performance
: experience with profiling, GPU acceleration, and resource optimization.

We Offer:
A healthy mix of startup-like culture of the company, which enables us to try new approaches and technologies and remain on the edge of technological development and enterprise, with stability and supporting functions to help you focus on your job.
Recognition from the business which translates to very competitive salaries and a supportive attitude.
Developing games featuring live video serving customers around the world.
Modern and developer-friendly delivery processes, including Agile (Scrum / Kanban), JIRA issue tracking, Confluence wiki, GitLab source control, Jenkins continuous integration and delivery, modern hardware and software for development (an IDE of your choice).
Being a part of an international team in a successful, publicly traded company.
Health insurance, contemporary office environment, international IT conferences, training, hackathons, top-notch equipment, and other benefits and perks.

:

: Share your LinkedIn profile or CV to express your interest.

A casual conversation where we get to know each other, answer basic questions, and discuss the role.

: An opportunity to assess your understanding of key concepts and identify areas where we can support your growth.

What Drives Us:
Our
mission
is simply to make operators successful and provide an excellent gaming experience for their end users.
Our
vision
is to be the leading online gaming provider in the world.
Our culture is rooted in our corporate
values
:
ALIVE
We are entrepreneurial, innovative and always on our toes, eager to catch the next opportunity. We challenge ourselves to do what no one has done before, and we deliver a unique end-user experience and first-class customer service, simply because
we try harder
. We look at our customers business as our business and opt to always be ahead of the game.
do RIGHT
We are committed to responsible gambling practices and to promoting a professional work environment which rewards integrity and high standards. We honor the trust that our customers put in us and recognize that our ability to deliver a reliable high-quality user experience is essential to our success. We strive to be an admirable employer and we believe in giving back to the communities in which we operate.
work TOGETHER
We recognize our diversity as a key strength. We promote an honest, inclusive and open work environment where we respect and support each other. Our pioneering ambition is dependent on our ability to work and develop together. At Evolution, every part of the chain counts.

1471344.title: Java vanemarendaja/arhitekt
1471344.description:
Sina oled oluline lüli lisandväärtuse loomisel.:
Kui soovid anda oma panuse Eesti riigi majandusse läbi suurte avalike organisatsioonide ning eraettevõtete strateegiliste töövahendite arendamise, siis tule ja liitu Fujitsu meeskonnaga.
Oma töös puutud kokku erinevate arendusinitsiatiivide elluviimisega, uute lahenduste väljatöötamisega ja põnevate projektide teostamisega - parimad praktikad kuuluvad selle kõige juurde.

Pakume Sulle paindlikkust ja piirideta arenguvõimalust ehk meie juures on Sul võimalik::
- töötada rahvusvahelises ettevõttes, mis pakub stabiilsust ja kindlust - oleme Eesti IT-turul tegutsenud juba üle 30 aasta:
- teha koostööd meeskonnas, kus kõiki
mõtteid ja ideid saab vabalt arutada, omavaheline hea huumor ning südamlik suhtumine käib tööpäeva juurde
;
- arendada oma professionaalseid oskusi ja teadmisi toote ja tehnoloogia valdkonnas ning erinevates Eestis või Soomes ärisektorites. Sinu arengut toetab ka
ligipääs LinkedIn Learning keskkonda
;
- nautida
töö- ja eraelu tasakaalu
, see tähendab, et pakume paindlikkust tööajas ja töökohas sul on
võimalus töötada kodus või meie Tallinna või Tartu kontoris.
- töötada meeskonnas, kelle
juht on hooliv, inimkeskne ja lahendustele orienteeritud
(tuginedes Fujitsu rahulolu uuringule saame kinnitada, et meeskond hindab oma juhti kõrgelt.)
Lisaks pakume muid ettevõtte hüvesid muuhulgas näiteks
7 kalendripäeva lisapuhkust,
tervisekindlustust või tervise- ja spordikompensatsiooni, haiguspäevade hüvitamist
jne.

Kui soovid liituda meiega, siis ootame Sinult::
- vähemalt
5-aastast infosüsteemide arendamise kogemust JAVA programmeerimiskeelega
;
- varasemat töökogemust JavaScript raamistike (Angular/React/Vue vms.), PostgreSQL/Oracle tehnoloogiatega;
- teadmisi ja praktilist kogemust konteinerite tehnoloogiatega (Kubernetes, Docker, HELM jne), et luua kaasaegseid ja skaleeritavaid lahendusi
- analüütilist ja arhitektuurset mõtlemist, mis toetab sind uute lahenduste arendamisel;
- teadmisi tarkvara turvalisuse nõuetest ja põhimõtetest;
- oskust juhtida nooremarendajaid, jagada neile ülesandeid, motiveerida ja õpetada;
- head eesti keele oskust;
Kui oled meile sooviavalduse teele saatnud, siis:
- tutvume Sinu avaldusega;
- positiivse otsuse korral kutsume MS Teams´i töövestlusele meie meeskonnajuhiga;
- teises vestlusvoorus osaled tehnilisel vestlusel meie vanemarendajaga;
- saadame tööpakkumise e-mailile.
Fujitsu Estonia väärtustab mitmekesisust ja kaasatust. Me usume, et igaühe ainulaadsus rikastab meie meeskonda. Meie juures hinnatakse igaühte ning diskrimineerimisele pole ruumi - kõik kandidaadid, olenemata nende taustast, on teretulnud.

Tarkvaraosakond tööandjana:
Meid võid usaldada. Oleme maailmaturul tegutsenud juba aastast 1935 ja Eestis 1991. Ühe suurima IT-ettevõttena oleme Eestis tööandjaks ligi 400 inimesele. Pikaajaline kogemus võimaldab meil oma töötajatele pakkuda kindlustunnet ja stabiilsust. Oleme usaldusväärsed tervikuna, mis tähendab, et igale meie meeskonnaliikmele saab loota.

1473131.title: Java Software Engineer
1473131.description:
1oT is expanding its team and looking for an engineer to join us in building connectivity solutions according to the new eSIM IoT standard.
1oT has built a platform for helping global IoT service providers manage their SIM cards and billing. The self-service based platform enables users to control and monitor SIM card sessions, switch SIM cards on/off, buy new SIMs, send SMS to the SIM, etc. Our client portfolio ranges from e-mobility to asset tracking to smart city solutions, so you will have interaction with a variety of IoT sectors and telecom companies.
eSIM team owns services that implement the eSIM standard of GSMA.

What you'll do::
Develop large-scale services ( Java / REST / Spring / SQL )
Contribute to back-office UI ( Vue.js )
Run and maintain AWS services ( Terraform / Docker / Grafana )
Participate in discussions on the architecture of the platform
Build eSIM infrastructure according to GSMA specs
Handle external integrations via APIs

What you'll bring::
3+ years of development experience (Java / REST / Spring / SQL)
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS / Azure / GCP)
Familiarity with modern UI frameworks is a plus
Experience with cryptography or HSM is a strong plus
Background in working with APIs

Youre a good fit if you..:
enjoy solving problems and turning ideas into clean, working solutions
take ownership of your tasks deadlines, goals, responsibilities
like collaborating, sharing ideas, and joining technical discussions
prefer action over bureaucracy and dont get stuck in corporate slow-motion
are curious, eager to learn, and excited about building things that dont yet exist
bring a positive, high-accountability approach to teamwork

Additional requirements:
Ability to work with APIs and integrations
Comfortable with security-focused development approaches
Willingness to collaborate closely with the eSIM team
A degree in Computer Science or a related field is beneficial but not mandatory. Practical experience matters more.

What we offer::
Meaningful, globally impactful work on cutting-edge eSIM technology
Diverse development tasks: new features, optimizations, refactoring
Opportunity to grow, influence, and shape products in a scaling company
Cozy, productive environment in our Tallinn HQ
Ambitious teammates who challenge the status quo daily
Supportive and fun team atmosphere

This includes systems for tracking customer account balances and ensuring financial data flows accurately across merchants and platforms. Whether working on transactional ledgers or customer-facing invoice flows, youll contribute to scalable, event-driven systems that support transparency, compliance, and a seamless user experience.
You will join one of our product teams and daily you will:

1466783.title: Director of Partner Ecosystem - Strategic Alliances & Marketplace
1466783.description:
Wrike is the most powerful work management platform. Built for teams and organizations looking to collaborate, create, and exceed every day, Wrike brings everyone and all work into a single place to remove complexity, increase productivity, and free people up to focus on their most purposeful work.
Our vision:
A world where everyone is free to focus on their most purposeful work, together.
About the Role:
As the strategic leader of Wrike's partner ecosystems consisting of - system integrators (SIs), ISV integration partners, channel resellers, and cloud marketplace partners, you'll spearhead the evolution of our 400+ partner network into a powerful growth engine. This role sits at the intersection of strategy and executionwhere you'll architect the future of Wrike's partner ecosystem while delivering measurable business impact through strategic partnerships.
You will thrive in this role if you're a visionary who can translate complex partner relationships into scalable business frameworks, while maintaining a laser focus on customer outcomes. You possess exceptional business acumen, can navigate enterprise GTM partnerships, and have a proven track record of building programs that drive joint revenue growth and customer success.
Your Impact:
Drive ecosystem strategy:
Develop and execute a comprehensive partner strategy that aligns with Wrike's business objectives, collaborating with key stakeholders to secure buy-in and resources
Architect partner success models:
Create scalable, repeatable frameworks for partner enablement, co-selling, and joint GTM activities that drive mutual success
Lead joint value creation:
Develop compelling business cases for integrations and partnerships, establishing clear ROI metrics and mutual commitments around sales, marketing, and product initiatives
Orchestrate Go-To-Market excellence:
Coordinate cross-functional resources to support partner GTM activities, ensuring seamless execution and alignment with Wrike's sales organization
Scale field enablement:
Build programs that empower sales teams to effectively position partner solutions, working closely with sales leadership, enablement, and customer success
Champion customer success:
Create joint customer references and success stories that showcase the powerful synergy between Wrike and partners
Drive innovation:
Identify emerging partnership opportunities and develop new use cases based on customer and partner feedback to solve complex workflow challenges
Your Qualifications:
8–10+ years of experience in SaaS partnerships, strategic alliances, or business development roles with demonstrated success
Proven track record building and scaling partner programs in a global, cross-functional capacity
Experience developing and executing partner GTM strategies that drive measurable business outcomes
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate partner data into actionable insights
Exceptional relationship-building capabilities across all organizational levels
Standout Qualities:
BS/BA degree, MBA preferred
Experience in work management, productivity, or collaboration software markets
Demonstrated success building marketplace strategies for SaaS products
Experience building joint GTM models and growth through system integrators value added resellers
Expertise in scaling growth through cloud marketplace hyperscalers like Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services and Azure
Track record of independently leading strategic initiatives that delivered significant business impact
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders
Experience in both high-growth and enterprise software environments
Team Dynamics:
We operate in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where strategic thinking meets execution excellence. Our partnership approach is data-driven, customer-centric, and focused on mutual growth. You'll have the autonomy to drive initiatives while collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and impact.
At Wrike, we're building the future of collaborative work management, and our partner ecosystem is central to that vision. Join us in creating powerful connections that deliver exceptional value to our customers worldwide.
Why Join Wrike?
28 calendar days of paid vacation
Sick leave compensation
Life insurance plan
Health insurance plan
Fitness plan (800 EUR/year)
Parental leave
2 volunteer days
Full-remote & On-demand access to Co-working space
Utility allowance (30 EUR/month, subject to taxation)
Your recruitment buddy will be Veronika Repková, Talent Sourcing Team Lead
#LI-VR3
Who Is Wrike and Our Culture
Were a team of innovators and creators who solve the complex work problems of today and tomorrow.
Hybrid work mode
Wrike promotes a hybrid model for team members near our office hubs in San Diego, Prague, Dublin, Nicosia, and Tallinn, with 2–3 in-office days per week to foster collaboration and teamwork. This work mode supports our culture of collaboration and solving problems fast to deliver business outcomes and win together.
Our persona
💡  Smart:
We love what we do, and were great at it because this is our domain. Our combined knowledge in this space is unmatched.
💚  Dedicated:
We get up every day focused on helping our customers win. Were committed to helping our teammates win, too!
🤗  Approachable:
We're friendly, easy to get along with, considerate, and helpful.
Our culture and Values
🤩 Customer-Focused
We care about our customers.
We understand the customer journey, experience, and value derived from Wrike. Decision-making and action-taking are done with the customer in mind.
🤝 Collaborative
We work as one and win together,
each bringing unique strengths that contribute to diversity of thought for better outcomes. Leveraging our own work management platform, we foster an environment of creative collaboration and shared achievement.
🎨 Creative
We strive to succeed through continuous innovation.
Its our pursuit of novel concepts that helped us create a market category. We continue to cultivate a workplace that fosters creative thinking as a means of transcending conventional boundaries and empowers us to break new ground to deliver extraordinary work management solutions.
💪 Committed
We believe in ownership at all levels of the organization,
by owning workflows from start to finish. Each member of our team is an integral part of this commitment, establishing work as a platform for personal growth and transformation, as well as collective success and growth.
Check out our LinkedIn Life Page, Company culture page, Instagram, Wrike Engineering Team, Medium, Meetup.com, Youtube for a feel for what life is like at Wrike.

1473955.description:
What will help you to succeed in the role::
•
5+ years of experience as a QA Engineer or Software Development Engineer in Test with multiple projects and technologies
• Experience developing automation test frameworks from the ground up.
• Proficient in unit-, functional-, performance-, load- and end-to-end testing

Designing, developing, and maintaining automated test scripts, frameworks, and tools to ensure high-quality software delivery

Investigating test failures, determining the root cause, and retesting resolved defects
Collaborating with the development team to ensure the application is testable, writing tests at the lowest possible level, achieving comprehensive test coverage, and adhering to shift-left principles
Participate in the definition of product requirements and acceptance criteria's
Provide QA expertise for the team, train and coach other software engineers
Collaborate with other QA's of different products to ensure good coverage and integration.
Work closely with the product owner, giving overview status and upcoming project quality plan.

Docker Compose, Azure DevOps, Allure Reports
Soap UI, JMeter, or other load-testing tools
Xray or other test management tools
Cypress / Playwright / Selenium is nice to have
Wiremock or similar mocking implementations

1468377.title: System Analyst
1468377.description:
System Analyst:
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, the company has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B and B2C businesses. Both divisions leverage Playtech's proprietary technology to deliver innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging, and entertaining gaming experience.
Playtech is the gaming industry's leading technology company, delivering business intelligence-driven gaming software, services, content, and platform technology across the industry. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Recognizing differences and ensuring our processes are transparent is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Playtech's
Videobet unit
is looking for an attentive

with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

1466630.title: DevOps Systems Engineer Road Logistics (m/w/d)
1466630.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel's global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
Are you a talented DevOps engineer with a passion for automation and solving complex challenges? Join our international team in Tallinn and play a pivotal role in building and supporting the successful delivery of value in our Road Logistics products.
The main focus of this role is development-oriented. You will design, implement, and maintain the DevOps platform that supports the development process and release pipelines for Road Logistics applications throughout the entire software development lifecycle. A key aspect of the role is optimizing workflows through automation and well-architected systems. Additionally, you will be involved in migrating applications to containers and cloud environments, including OpenShift, Kubernetes, and AWS. Ensuring the efficient utilization of cloud-based infrastructure and services across all teams is essential, preventing silos or knowledge islands. You will also champion best practices such as observability, Infrastructure-as-Code, and GitOps, seamlessly integrating them into the existing infrastructure and processes.
How you create impact
Taking part in managing non-production and production environments for Road Logistics applications.
Implementing observability pillars with centralized monitoring, logging and alerting.
Automating tasks and processes as much as possible.
Collaborating with infrastructure and product development teams to improve applications and processes.
Ensure security and compliance across all stages of the software development lifecycle.
Promoting DevOps culture and mindset.
What we would like you to bring
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role (DevOps Engineer, SRE, or Platform Engineer).
Hands-on experience with at least one major cloud provider, preferably AWS.
Strong Linux background with experience in configuration management tools (Ansible preferred).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools, ideally Jenkins or GitLab, with experience in automation and deployment.
Scripting skills for automating routine tasks using Python, Groovy, or Bash.
Expertise in container tooling and orchestration, such as Kubernetes or OpenShift.
Ability to develop scalable solutions that do not reinvent the wheel but can rather themselves serve as blueprints for tackling similar or even new challenges.
Experience working in hybrid infrastructures, securely connecting cloud and on-premises environments, with strong collaboration skills in international teams and proficiency in English (spoken and written).
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, you'll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You'll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.
Who we are
Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.
As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.
We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

You inspire individuals and teams to accomplish organizational goals.

To be successful in this role, you have the following::

The Timber Sales Manager contributes to the growth and secures sustained profitability of the business, in line with and building on the Ingka Investments Direction focusing on maximizing timber sales revenues.

More specifically, this means you will::
Lead and secure the development of sales
which reflects long and short-term strategic objectives of Ingka Investments and identifies business opportunities in the market;
Drive the commercial agenda to maximize the net present value of the forest assets;
Manage timber sales, budget items, and goals; monitor KPIs and take action on deviation;
Ensure full insight / transparency of gross timber incomes and cost items (harvesting costs, transportations costs, etc.);
Manage commercial relations with business partners or contractors of Ingka Investments;
Identify appropriate benchmarks that allow for assessing and adapting sales tactics under changing conditions in the timber market;
Secure access to the forest with commercial purposes.

We offer::

Excellent working conditions
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Wide range of employees benefits

tauno.kusma@ingka.com

About us:
NoCry is an Estonian company with a small yet powerful team doing big things. We are one of the fastest-growing work gear brands on Amazon. With over 5 million customers worldwide, we aim to become the global go-to source for workwear and PPE.
Our Mission is to empower hardworking people with functional and durable gear crafted from real-world needs, not boardroom decisions.
We're looking for a
Junior Product Development Engineer,
someone who loves building things, experimenting, learning by doing, and turning ideas into real, testable products. If you enjoy prototyping and solving hands-on problems, and seeing your work come to life, we'd love to meet you.

What Youll Do:
Engineer and build prototypes
take product ideas from sketches to functional, testable prototypes using SolidWorks and rapid prototyping tools.
Solve real-world engineering problems
through creative thinking, iteration, and practical testing.
Design and develop mechanical systems
and components for PPE and workwear accessories, ensuring reliability and manufacturability.
Lead root-cause analysis
on design or production issues, developing practical and lasting fixes.
Continuously optimize designs
for strength, cost, usability, and assembly efficiency.
Support the full development
cycle from concept sketch to working prototype to production handoff.

To succeed in this role, you'll need::
A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Design, Industrial Design Engineering, or a related field.
Some experience with SolidWorks or any CAD software (student projects count!).
Basic understanding of manufacturing processes like injection molding or simple mechanical assemblies.
Curiosity, creativity, and a strong desire to build, test, learn, and improve.
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership of small projects.
Bonus points for:
Experience with 3D scanning technologies for precision modeling.
Background in wearable, ergonomic, sporting, safety, or tactical gear design.
Hands-on experience with high-volume manufacturing (die casting, machining, stamping).

What's it like to work with us?:
Joining our team offers a one-of-a-kind experience at Estonia's largest e-commerce company on Amazon. We're on a mission to establish ourselves as a top global brand in safety gear and work apparel, and you could play a pivotal role in our journey to success. Expect engaging and challenging work that directly influences our business outcomes. We have hybrid working opportunities, a Stebby package, and fun team gatherings.
We're excited to receive your application if you're fueled by passion, thrive on pushing boundaries, and crave an environment that fosters innovation, freedom, and responsibility.
Don't miss this opportunity to make a meaningful difference with us!

Playtech is the gambling industry's leading technology company delivering business intelligence-driven gambling software, services, content, and platform technology across the industry's most popular product verticals, including, casino, live casino, sports betting, virtual sports, bingo and poker. Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Ready to level up your career?

with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Press play and let us design future technology together!
Your influential mission. You will...
Define, establish and implement organizational information security processes, to ensure business, regulatory, legislative and contractual requirements and obligations are met.
Manage the internal and external ISMS audit processes, monitor effectiveness of controls and corrective actions in cooperation with the stakeholders across the organization.
Manage gap analysis, compliance readiness, and compliance monitoring activities for ISO/IEC 27001, PCI DSS and other regulatory security audits.
Coordinate external security audits, assessments and testing as well as remediation plans development and implementation.

Develop content, coordinate and facilitate a comprehensive organizational information security awareness training program.
Manage security requirements with third parties, including due diligence of products and services providers and information security requirements clauses in service provision agreements and contracts.
Develop, coordinate and maintain information security policies, procedures and other security related documents.
Analyse, map and communicate information security requirements, that derive from legislative and regulatory obligations in various jurisdictions.
Serve as project manager/lead within security projects.
Continually improve and update knowledge to accommodate changes to the company's regulatory environment and needs.
Components for success. You have...

Bachelors Degree in Information Security, Information Assurance, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Risk Management or equivalent work experience

Demonstrated advanced proficiency in leveraging AI tools and automation to design, execute, and optimize marketing campaigns.

1469463.title: Mapping Team Lead
1469463.description:
Starship Technologies is revolutionizing deliveries with autonomous robots. These robots are designed to deliver food, groceries, and packages across college campuses and neighborhoods in minutes. Starship has now completed millions of autonomous deliveries to date, traveled millions of miles, and is currently doing more than 140k road crossings each day. Our contribution to society includes reducing congestion, and pollution, providing zero-emissions deliveries, increasing the quality of life for residents, empowering seniors and disabled people, and enabling affordable delivery for local businesses.
With over 300 locations in 6 countries worldwide, we have brought a series of world firsts as we launched robotic delivery in new cities, areas, and countries. Our deliveries are profitable due to significant technology investment, and combined with substantial commercial momentum and interest, expanding to new partners and locations has become the beating heart of our growth.
Were looking for a
Mapping Team Lead
to join our
Autonomous Driving team
. Mapping Team is one of the three pillars of our ability to expand and scale with confidence they are responsible for, critically, high-precision maps that make our robots smarter, safer and faster. This is a unique opportunity to lead, shape, and drive a critical part of how we adapt robotics to fit, suit, and serve local communities in countries across the world.
Your main responsibilities are:
Prioritisation & Planning
Drive excellent prioritisation, scheduling, and planning to maximise price-to-performance impact across the team.
Plan and sequence work across map additions, geographic expansions, and safety-critical tasks.
Use data fluently to forecast hiring needs, track performance, and guide operational decisions.
Cross-Functional Teamwork
Collaborate closely with teams such as Commercial, Launch, Public Affairs, and Local/Remote Operations to ensure alignment, clarity, and shared outcomes.
High Velocity Execution
Operate effectively in a fast-moving environment with rapidly increasing launch velocity.
Stay calm, decisive, and outcome-focused amid ambiguity, shifting deadlines, and incomplete information.
Operational & Tooling Improvements
Identify and drive improvements in tools, software, workflows, and systems to increase efficiency, safety, and long-term scalability.
Advocate for automation and scalable long-term solutions.
Team Growth & Development
Grow, mentor, and develop a high-impact team with strong ownership, engagement, and clarity of purpose.
Lead the evolution of team responsibilities as Starship changes and as automation changes processes.
What's in it for you?
This is a wildly unique role: an opportunity to lead a key scaling team, working to expand industry-leading self-driving delivery robot technology on a uniquely large scale, creating history.
You will have the opportunity to shape and build a unique system for expansion, and to grow the team around it, including working with sister engineering teams in Autonomous Driving to improve the process of expansion.
Work with extremely passionate and motivated people across the company in operations, engineering and commercial.
You can immerse yourself in the world of technology and innovation.
You'll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.
What we hope you'll bring to the table:
Experience in data analysis (including exploratory analysis) and using data for decision-making and forecasting.
Ability to think strategically, predict outcomes, and guide teams to adapt effectively.
Proven team leadership experience: mentoring, growing, and motivating a team to deliver impact.
A proven ability to thrive under pressure, tight deadlines, and changing conditions.
Exceptional prioritisation skills across very different tasks and outcomes.
Excellent communicator with strong relationship-building skills, able to align, inspire, and collaborate across teams.
Want to learn more about our robots and our people? Get in touch and lets have a chat! Also, have a sneak peek to our blog and discover more about us!

1468873.description:
Your new adventure:
As a Platform Operations Engineer, you will join our global Internal IT team and play an essential part in our mission to provide the world with affordable and environment-friendly deliveries. Every day, our robots are completing thousands of autonomous deliveries in the US, UK and Europe, and were hitting records on an almost weekly basis.
This role is a direct step toward proactive Platform Engineering moving us beyond daily operational IT into true system ownership and security optimization. Your primary responsibility will be serving as the resident expert for the security and optimization of our core collaboration and productivity platforms. Your focus will be on eliminating manual work through automation and enforcing a strong security posture.

Your main responsibilities::
Core Platform Administration: Lead the management of Okta (IAM, SSO, MFA, provisioning) ; administration, security management and automations in Google Workspace, Atlassian (Jira/Confluence workflows), Slack etc.
Automation Engineering: Utilize scripting (e.g. Python, PowerShell, Google Apps Script) to automate administrative tasks, eliminate manual work, and build reliable integrations between internal applications.
Security & Governance: Implement access lifecycle management, and regularly review and improve information security in internal tools. Contribute to various regular security assessment reviews.
Tier 2 Escalation: Act as the final technical expert for platform-related issues, providing advanced troubleshooting beyond standard support channels.
Documentation: Create and maintain high-quality documentation for configurations, procedures, and governance.

What's in it for you? :
You will collaborate with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We take pride in our ability to make the most of limited resources to solve problems no one has ever encountered before.
We are a fast-growing startup, with great opportunities to grow within the company. Your contribution will matter. There are lots of ways you can make a difference and personally feel the impact.
Youll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.

What we hope you'll bring to the table: :
Hands-on experience in cloud application or systems administration within a fast-growing business environment.
Expertise in the administration and architecture of at least one of the following: Okta, Atlassian (Jira/Confluence), Google Workspace, or Slack. Since you will be the lead admin for all core platforms, demonstrable experience across a combination of these systems is a significant advantage.
Strong practical understanding of Identity and Access Management (IAM) principles and security controls (MFA, DLP).

Excellent verbal and written English skills are required to clearly communicate complex technical requirements to non-technical stakeholders.
