1475010.title: Principal Systems & Safety Engineer
1475010.description:
Starship Technologies is revolutionizing deliveries with autonomous robots. These robots are designed to deliver food, groceries, and packages across college campuses and neighborhoods in minutes. Starship has now completed millions of autonomous deliveries to date, traveled millions of miles, and is currently doing more than 140k road crossings each day. Our contribution to society includes reducing congestion and pollution, providing zero-emissions deliveries, increasing the quality of life for residents, empowering seniors and disabled people, and enabling affordable delivery for local businesses.
We're hitting records on an almost weekly basis. Now is an exciting time to join as we grow rapidly around the world!
We're looking for a
Principal Systems & Safety Engineer
to join our
Hardware Engineering team
. As a Principal Systems & Safety Engineer, you'll play a critical role in our product development process for robots from concept to launch. You will be a key technical voice on product safety and compliance, ensuring our system architecture and design meet and exceed regulatory requirements. This is an opportunity to have a major impact on our products and grow your leadership skills by driving significant improvements in our compliance framework.
Your main responsibilities are:
Driving improvements to our compliance framework: You'll identify opportunities and lead initiatives to make a step-change improvement in our existing compliance and safety processes, ensuring we stay ahead of global standards (e.g., CE, IEC, ISO, UL).
Translating standards into requirements: You'll analyse complex safety standards and regulations and translate them into clear, verifiable system and subsystem requirements for our hardware and software teams.
Analysing system architecture: You'll review the system architectures to identify potential hazards, ensure safety-critical functions are robust, and guide design choices from the start.
Conducting technical risk assessments: You'll lead and document technical risk assessments, including Hazard Analysis and Risk Assessment (HARA) and Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) at the system level.
Contributing to product certifications: You'll be a key part of the certification process, preparing technical documentation and collaborating with external labs to ensure successful product validation.
Developing validation strategies: You'll work with our test and validation teams to create and execute test plans that verify compliance and validate the safety of the overall system.
What's in it for you?
Opportunity to work on industry-leading self-driving delivery robot technology on a uniquely large scale, creating history and making things happen.
You can immerse yourself in the world of technology and innovation.
You will have a chance to work with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We don't want to wait until we are told what needs to be done but take it as a matter of pride to figure out solutions for topics in various teams and areas.
You'll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe.
What we're looking for:
A systems-level thinker: You can understand how different components of a complex system interact and can anticipate potential failure modes.
A passion for building safe, complex systems: You're excited about the challenge of building robust consumer robots and are committed to ensuring they are safe and reliable.
A growth mindset: You're eager to learn and grow, and you're not afraid to take on new challenges. We're looking for someone who wants to become a leader in this field.
A collaborative spirit: You're a great communicator and enjoy working with cross-functional teams to solve challenging problems.
A proactive problem-solver: You're a self-starter who can identify potential issues and develop creative solutions.
We'd love to hear from you if you have:
Extensive experience in systems engineering, compliance, safety, or a related role.
Familiarity with product safety standards (e.g., IEC 61508, ISO 26262, UL 3300).
Proven experience writing and managing technical requirements.
Strong background in risk assessment methodologies (e.g., FMEA, HARA).
If you're excited about this role but don't meet all the requirements, we'd still encourage you to apply.
Want to learn more about our robots and our people? Get in touch and lets have a chat! Also, have a sneak peek to our blog and discover more about us!

Founded in 1999 and premium listed on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange, Playtech is a technology leader in the gambling industry with over 7,000 employees across 20 countries.
Playtech is the gambling industry's leading technology company delivering business intelligence-driven gambling software, services, content, and platform technology across the industry's most popular product verticals, including, casino, live casino, sports betting, virtual sports, bingo and poker. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtech.com & www.playtechpeople.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Recognizing differences and ensuring our processes are transparent is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?

is looking for a proactive

with great communication skills.
Press play and let us design future technology together!

Qualifications

Have strong analytical capabilities and attention to detail

You'll get extra points for...

Thrive in a culture that values...
Initiative-taking and confident approach at the workplace
Global scope and inclusive working environment

The team is a part of Playtech's Infrastructure unit that provides private cloud platform services to all Playtech Products. Our small, tight-knit team keenly monitors our business unit's compliance with all regulations' requirements and our high standards of responsible gambling. We use our analytical skills to understand audit controls, communication skills to gather and present the needed evidence, and our trait for attention to detail to map it all to our knowledge base.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1472277.title: Product Owner (Mechanical)
1472277.description:
Role overview: :
We're looking for an experienced Product Owner/Mechanical Engineer with strong NPI and product ownership expertise to join our Product Development team at Stargate Hydrogen. You will be responsible for managing the complete mechanical integration lifecycle - from product introduction through serial manufacturing - with a strong focus on engineering documentation control, change management, and ensuring seamless transitions from development to production.
If you have hands-on experience with complex mechanical product development, serial manufacturing, ERP systems, and take pride in owning products from conception to scaled production, this role offers the perfect opportunity to make a tangible impact in the hydrogen technology sector. You're naturally detail-oriented, thrive in collaborative environments, and are ready to drive quality and efficiency across engineering, production, and quality functions.
We are seeking candidates currently located in Estonia.
Must-have qualifications:
University degree in Engineering, Physics or Chemistry
2+ years in mechanical product development and serial manufacturing
Proven NPI experience from development to production
Strong CAD and PDM/PLM skills for design and document control
ERP experience in engineering documentation and BoM management
Strong process orientation and attention to traceability
Excellent problem-solving and ownership mindset
Strong teamwork and communication skills in English
Nice-to-have qualifications:
Project or program management experience
Product ownership background, managing design revisions and lifecycle
Advanced Inventor and Vault proficiency
Experience with alkaline electrolyser stacks or components
Expertise in mechanical design for manufacturability
Knowledge of hydrogen/process industry manufacturing
Familiarity with DfM principles
Understanding of ISO 22734, PED, ISO 9001, ISO 13849

What does day-to-day look like in this role? :
Engineering Documentation & ERP Management
Own and maintain mechanical design documentation in the ERP system BoMs, drawings, 3D/CAD data, and specifications. Ensure all records are accurate, traceable, and version-controlled, keeping production, quality, and suppliers aligned with the latest data.
New Product Introduction (NPI)
Lead mechanical integration for new product launches, managing the transition from development to serial production. Secure production readiness through complete documentation, validated processes, and qualified suppliers. Coordinate with engineering, production, quality, and supply teams to meet timelines and standards.
Change Implementation & Design Upgrades
Manage design changes and upgrades driven by production feedback or improvement initiatives. Conduct impact analyses, lead reviews, align stakeholders, and control timing of change implementation to ensure full compliance with updated specs.
Serial Production Support
Be the technical bridge between engineering and production. Support troubleshooting, non-conformance resolution, and root cause analysis. Coordinate corrective actions with suppliers and participate in risk analyses (FMEA, HAZOP).
Supplier Coordination
Define and maintain technical specifications for critical components. Oversee supplier documentation, compliance, and communication. Support problem-solving and ensure specifications are implemented correctly in production.
Process & Documentation Optimisation
Continuously improve workflows for product changes, documentation, and supplier management. Capture production and quality feedback to refine NPI and preventive processes for future releases.

Why us?:
You will join a world-class team of 65+ experienced and goal-driven professionals and hydrogentechnology experts
We are an agile scale-up wishing to make a difference in a field typically dominated by large andslow behemoths
We have secured a €29m state aid via the Important Projects of Common European Interest (IPCEI) framework, and are backed by our existing investors such as UGI and Repsol
The performance of our ceramic electrode technology has been independently validated by Fraunhofer IFAM in Dresden, and the performance of our prototype stack by ZSW in Stuttgart
Whats in it for you?
You will be able to contribute to electrolysis technology and its novel applications, thereby participating in creating a net-zero world
You can accelerate your career and enjoy professional growth opportunities
We have a flexible policy you can organise your work between the office and remotely to get the best results and enjoy flexible working hours
You can choose between employer health insurance or sports compensation
We organise regular team events and company Summer Days that foster camaraderie, collaboration, and fun outside of the workplace
If you're interested in relocation, we're based in Estonia, which offers a flat income tax of 22%, great access to abundant nature and is the most advanced digital society
We aim to fill this position at the earliest opportunity, so we encourage interested candidates to submit their applications promptly.
You can expect a response from us within two weeks of your application date.

1476464.title: Senior Backend Engineer (m\w\d)
1476464.description:
Job description:
It's more than a job
In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagels' global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.
As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will be part of the team owning the development of scalable, accessible and performant web interfaces to deliver intuitive user experiences that align with KNs brand and business goals. You will lead the backend architectural decisions and ensure long-term maintainability of the systems. This role is critical for maintaining and evolving the backend and middleware systems that power KNs global websites and digital platforms. You will work closely with frontend developers, DevOps engineers and QA experts to deliver scalable, secure and high-performing solutions.
How you create impact
Design, develop, and maintain backend services and middleware components for KNs global web platforms.
Ensure quality through automated testing (unit, integration, UI, performance).
Design and optimize database models and queries, ensuring efficient performance and scalability for high-traffic environments.
Follow clean code practices and development standards while actively participating in code reviews, architecture discussions, and continuous improvement initiatives.
Proactively improve the codebase: refactor for simplicity, performance, and maintainability on a continuous basis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (PO, Frontend, DevOps, QA) to ensure seamless integration and deployment.
Implement best practices for security, data integrity, and API design.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues in production environments.
What we would like you to bring
5+ years of experience in backend development, preferably in enterprise-scale environments.
Strong proficiency in Java, Spring Boot, Kotlin and RESTful API development.
Experience with middleware technologies and integration patterns.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and version control (GitLab, Bitbucket).
Understanding of security best practices and performance optimisation.
Nice to have experience with CMS platforms (StoryBlok) and knowledge of microservices architecture and event-driven systems.
Exposure to observability tools and monitoring frameworks.
What's in it for you
Join Kuehne+Nagel's IT Hub in Tallinn, where your work will have a meaningful impact on the logistics industry. Here, you'll find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You'll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don't tick every box, we encourage you to apply - your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

1473499.title: Employer Branding and Communications Partner
1473499.description:
Employer Branding and Communications Partner :
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, Playtech has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B business. By leveraging proprietary technology, Playtech delivers innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging, and entertaining gaming experience.
As the gaming industry's leading technology company, Playtech combines business intelligence-driven software, services, content, and platform technology to drive excellence and innovation across the sector. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com and www.playtech.com.
At Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Embracing differences and maintaining transparency in our processes is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Are you passionate about shaping how a leading tech company is seen by the world? Playtech Estonia is searching for an enthusiastic
Employer Branding and Communications Partner
to drive our brand and communications strategy locally and support globally. If you thrive in a dynamic environment, love building relationships, and want to make a real impact, this is your chance to join a team where your ideas matter.
Your Influential Mission: You Will...
Local Focus
Lead impactful communication:
Drive external and internal communications for Playtech Estonia, ensuring our voice is clear, engaging, and aligned with our brand.
Shape our employer brand:
Develop and execute strategies that position Playtech as a top employer in Estonias tech industry.
Showcase Playtech at events:
Organize and manage our presence at career fairs and IT conferences, creating memorable experiences for attendees.
Be our ambassador:
Host office visits for guests and students, sharing Playtechs culture and values.
Manage public engagement:
Respond to external inquiries, sponsorship requests, and collaboration opportunities with professionalism and creativity.
Lead CSR initiatives:
Drive local Corporate Social Responsibility projects and contribute to global programs that make a positive impact.
Empower brand ambassadors:
Coordinate and inspire our local Brand Ambassador group to strengthen internal engagement.
Create engaging content:
Manage Playtech Estonias social media channels (Facebook, Instagram) with fresh, authentic content.
Global Focus
Lead internal and global People and Culture communications:
Collaborate with global teams to keep employees informed and engaged, manage the communications calendar, and ensure consistent messaging across regions.
Develop and deliver People & Culture communications:
Create and implement content, maintain templates, and coordinate timing to align global and local priorities.
Components for Success: You...
Are proactive, independent, and confident in decision-making.
Build strong relationships across all levels and functions.
Demonstrate fluency in Estonian (native level) and English (both written and spoken).
Bring hands-on experience in employer branding, communications, or related fields.
Have a higher education (Bachelors or Masters) in marketing, communications, business, or a relevant area, or equivalent practical experience.
Possess an analytical mindset, able to use data and insights to drive strategy and improvements.
Thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment, creating structure and processes where needed.
You'll Get Extra Points For...
Experience in digital marketing, social media management, or content creation.
Certifications in communications, marketing, or related fields.
Previous achievements in employer branding or communications roles.
Experience organizing or supporting CSR initiatives.
Knowledge of the Estonian tech industry or labor market.
Thrive in a Culture That Values...
Independence and trust, no micromanagement, just empowerment.
Collaboration with passionate, supportive colleagues.
Opportunities for growth, development, and making a real impact.
A diverse, inclusive, and welcoming environment.
How to Apply?
In addition to your CV, please add a brief
cover
letter covering your goals, your current experience in employer branding, communications, or related fields, and/or working in a corporate environment. You can write it in the comment section at the end of the application page (under "your message to the hiring manager").
Meet the Team
Join a vibrant, collaborative team at Playtech Estonia, where your ideas and expertise will help shape our employer brand and communications strategy. Youll work alongside passionate professionals who value initiative, creativity, and partnership. Be part of a business thats making a difference, locally and globally.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

1463659.title: Operational manager
1463659.description:
Operational Manager (Entry to Mid-Level):
We are looking for a practical and responsible person who enjoys working with their hands and figuring out how things work. You do not need to already be a laundry technician what matters is curiosity, initiative, and willingness to learn step-by-step.
You will help keep our self-service laundromat locations running smoothly and make sure customers have a good experience. A lot of learning will happen directly from real situations, with support from teammates across the Baltics.
This role is active and varied, not a desk job:
some days you will be on-site checking machines and equipment,
other days you will be answering customer calls or helping on-site,
and at times you will be preparing improvements or assisting in opening new laundromats.

What the job includes::
- Visiting laundromat locations to check equipment and overall condition
- Ensuring washing machines and dryers work properly (we will guide you as you learn)
- Solving practical technical issues when they appear
- Helping customers by phone and sometimes on-site
- Keeping track of tasks and making sure they are completed
- Assisting with installations or adjustments when opening new laundromats
- Organizing and overseeing cleaning and basic maintenance work
Learning here is
hands-on
and gradual you will build your knowledge step by step.

Who will fit well in this role:
- You like working with tools and equipment
- You are not afraid to learn by doing and ask questions when needed
- You think calmly and logically when solving problems
- You take responsibility and finish what you start
- You can plan your time and work independently once you know what to do
- You speak
Estonian, English
and
Russian
- You have a
B-category drivers license
and
your own car
(fuel and car wear are compensated)
- You can provide references
No formal technical education is required. The key factor is
motivation to learn
.

Why join us?:
- The chance to learn practical technical skills that are valuable in many careers
- Real responsibility and visible results when you fix something, it matters immediately
- Varied work in different locations (not sitting behind a screen all day)
- Supportive colleagues across Baltics learning happens together
- The opportunity to grow into wider responsibilities as your skills develop (technical maintenance, location operations, installation projects)
If you are someone who enjoys practical work, wants to learn how equipment works, and takes pride in doing things well we would be glad to talk.

Working hours::
Full-time

Workplace::
Primary Tallin, but spots to be supervised could be spread across all Estonia

Salary::
Salary: up to 2500 EUR/month gross, depending on experience and skill level. Salary increases as your skills and responsibilities grow.
www.laundromat.ee

1466614.title: Network Operations Engineer
1466614.description:
Network Operations Engineer:
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, the company has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B business. By leveraging its proprietary technology, Playtech delivers innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging and entertaining gaming experience.
As the gaming industry's leading technology company, it combines business intelligence-driven software, services, content, and platform technology to drive excellence and innovation across the sector. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com and www.playtech.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Embracing differences and maintaining transparency in our processes is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career? Join Playtech as a Network Operations Engineer!
Are you ready to make an impact in the world of cutting-edge infrastructure?
Playtech's
Infrastructure team is searching for a driven and innovative
Network Operations Engineer
to help keep the digital gears turning smoothly. If solving challenges excites you and networking is your playground, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for.
Your influential mission. You will...

Shape the Future: Maintain firewall rules and configure load-balancer business logic with the guidance of an experienced team.
Innovate & Experiment: Be part of infrastructure-focused R&D projects that push boundaries.
Build Smarter: Help to develop automation tools to optimize processes.
Be the Guardian: Take on on-call duties to ensure network infrastructure remains rock-solid 24/7.
Components for success. You...
Are a Creative Thinker: You approach problems like a true engineer, thinking outside the box and crafting both tailored and standardized solutions.
Excel as a Networking Pro: You're experienced in building and maintaining robust network infrastructures that support diverse products.
Demonstrate Technical Know-How: Your hands-on expertise spans firewalls, load balancers, switches, routers, and DDoS mitigation solutions (bonus points if CheckPoint, F5, Juniper, or Cisco is in your arsenal!).
Remain Cool Under Pressure: You excel in dynamic situations, adapting quickly and strategically while juggling multiple tasks with precision.
Leverage Automator Extraordinaire: You prefer to work smart by leveraging scripting, automation, and orchestration tools.
Communicate and Connect Effectively: With your polished English communication skills, you effortlessly collaborate with colleagues and clients.
You'll get extra points for...
Familiarity with cloud networking concepts and public cloud platforms (like AWS) gives you a winning edge!
Thrive in a culture that values...
Innovative Projects: Tackle unique challenges with industry-leading tools and technology.
Expert Mentorship: Work alongside top-notch specialists and accelerate your learning.
Holistic Growth: Enjoy support for your professional journey, active lifestyle, and mental well-being.
Community Spirit: Engage in exciting events and enjoy perks that make you proud to belong.
INFRASTRUCTURE UNIT
Our infrastructure is spread over 20 different countries and 34 data centers. We rely on 25 000 virtual machines and have 39 000 TB of storage space.
Impressive? Using cutting-edge technologies, we provide central IT infrastructure services to business and internal customers worldwide.
NETWORK OPERATIONS TEAM
The Network Operations team is a dynamic and highly skilled group of Engineers who are ensuring the seamless functioning of digital networks. They possess a deep understanding of complex network architectures and protocols, allowing them to tackle any challenge that comes their way. With our collaborative spirit and unwavering commitment to excellence, we form a cohesive team that thrives on innovation and pushes the boundaries of what is possible in the world of networking.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

Full-Time French & Spanish Teacher, starting August 2026.
ISE is a private, co-educational, not-for-profit institution located in Tallinn, Estonia. It is the only fully accredited international school in the country, authorised to deliver the full International Baccalaureate (IB) Continuum (PYP, MYP, and DP), and accredited by both the New England Association of Schools and Colleges (NEASC) and the Council of International Schools (CIS).

University degree in Education or relevant field.

Ability to provide a recent
clear police record / criminal background check
Desirable Qualifications and Professional Attributes:
Training and/or experience in the IB PYP, MYP, DP.
Demonstrated commitment to high standards of teaching and learning.
Capacity to inspire, motivate, and support students in achieving their potential.
Professionalism, flexibility, and a collaborative approach to working within an international school environment.
Conditions of Appointment:
ISE offers a competitive salary and, for overseas candidates, an additional benefits package that includes: accommodation allowance, relocation & support, comprehensive international medical insurance.
Application Procedure:

A letter of interest and introduction
Curriculum Vitae
Contact details of two professional referees

no later than January 31, 2026.

Should a very suitable applicant be identified before that date, the school reserves the right to make an immediate appointment. 1470691.title: Legal Assistant
1470691.description:
LEGAL ASSISTANT
We are seeking a highly organised and proactive Legal Assistant to join ESTOs Legal team in Tallinn. You will be working closely with our lawyers, customer support, debt collection teams, and external partners to ensure that legal processes run smoothly and that our communication with authorities and debt collection agencies is timely, accurate, and professional.
If you thrive in an international, fastpaced, fintech environment, enjoy taking ownership, and want to grow your legal skills, this role is for you.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide comprehensive daily administrative and legal support to the Legal team and the rest of the business.
Take full ownership of the legal inbox, including correspondence with debt collection agencies, regulatory authorities, bankruptcy trustees, bailiffs, police, prosecutors office, courts and other institutions.
Provide legal and technical support in civil and criminal proceedings, including filing claims, drafting responses and, where needed, participating in court hearings under lawyer supervision.
Ensure the Legal teams internal knowledge base and documentation are kept in excellent, uptodate order.
Prepare and file documentation with business registries and other relevant registers.
Conduct targeted legal and regulatory research (including on upcoming regulatory changes) and summarise key findings for the Legal team and stakeholders.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelors degree in Law.
Previous work experience in the legal field is an advantage (e.g. law firm, inhouse, court, bailiff, notary, public authority). Experience with financial services regulation in Estonia or the EU is a plus.
Estonian as a native language or at C1 level and very good command of English, both written and spoken.
Highly organized, detailoriented, able to manage deadlines and work independently.
Positive, humble, and collaborative, with strong communication skills and a genuine interest in continuous learning and taking on new challenges.
WE OFFER:
🌟 Be Part of Something BIG:
Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing fintech company.
🤝 Work with the Best:
Join a tight-knit, highly skilled team where open communication and collaboration drive success.
🏡 Work Your Way:
Enjoy a hybrid setup, balancing office time and remote work to suit your lifestyle.
🛡 Weve Got You Covered:
Benefit from sick leave compensation, additional health days, and a flexible work environment that prioritizes your well-being.
🎉 Stay Active and Connected:
Take birthday leave, join fun team events, and enjoy plenty of opportunities to unwind.

1474733.description:
Requirements:
Masters degree in Law.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant legal experience, ideally a combination of in-house and reputable law firm work.
Strong background in corporate and commercial law; experience in aviation, transportation, or other regulated industries is a strong advantage.
Demonstrated ability to manage complex contracts, cross-border matters, and multi-stakeholder environments.
Ability to work independently, prioritize effectively, and provide pragmatic, business-oriented solutions in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills in English and Estonian; proficiency in German is considered an asset.

Description:
The Head of Legal will play a critical role in shaping and overseeing Marabus legal function. This position serves as the primary legal advisor to senior leadership and ensures the company operates in full compliance with corporate, regulatory, and industry-specific requirements. The role combines strategic guidance with hands-on legal support across corporate governance, commercial matters, employment law, and risk management.
Responsibilities
1. Legal Leadership & Governance
Serve as the primary legal advisor to the CFO, CEO, and senior leadership team.
Establish and lead the in-house legal function, including developing internal legal processes, contract templates, and governance frameworks.
Ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, in cooperation with regulators and external legal counsel.
2. Corporate & Regulatory
Oversee corporate governance matters, including Board and shareholder resolutions, corporate filings, and group-structure topics.
Support corporate restructuring, financing activities, and intercompany agreements.
Advise on regulatory matters relevant to aviation, competition, and other applicable legal frameworks.
3. Commercial & Contracting
Draft, negotiate, and review a broad range of commercial agreements related to the companys operations.
Support the procurement function and ensure adherence to internal policies, compliance standards, and risk management principles.
4. Employment & HR
Advise on employment law in Estonia and other relevant jurisdictions.
Support HR with drafting and reviewing employment agreements, internal policies, and employee relations matters.
Provide guidance on cross-border labor topics, including crewing-related agreements and regulatory requirements.
5. Disputes, Claims & Risk Management
Manage litigation, pre-litigation, and dispute resolution processes involving customers, suppliers, airports, and regulatory bodies.
Coordinate with external counsel to ensure efficient and cost-effective dispute handling.
Identify legal risks across the business and develop appropriate mitigation strategies.
6. Leadership & Stakeholder Management
Act as a trusted advisor to internal teams across the organization.
Build and maintain strong relationships with external legal advisors, regulators, and business partners.
Deliver legal training and awareness sessions to internal stakeholders.

Benefits:
Inspiring and truly unique experience at the newest Estonian airline
Competitive compensation package
Additional 7 days of vacation per year
Paid sick leave from first day and three health days
Development and career opportunities
Flexible working environment
Opportunity to work with a dynamic and multicultural industry-leading team
A modern office in Ülemiste, filled with exciting office events

Interlux Travel on rahvusvaheline reisikorraldaja, kellel on üle 10 aasta kogemust kvaliteetsete ja nõutud reiside korraldamisel Balti riikides ja väljaspool. Meie meeskond kasvab, mistõttu otsime oma professionaalsesse kollektiivi positiivset, suhtlemisvalmis ja aktiivset reisikonsultanti.
Sinult ootame:
Eesti ja vene keele oskust kõnes ja kirjas
Valmidust õppida ja uusi väljakutseid vastu võtta
Positiivset ellusuhtumist ja head probleemilahendusoskust
Enesekindlust arvutikasutamisel ning suhtlemisel e-posti ja telefoni teel
Eelnev töökogemus turismi, müügi või klienditeeninduse valdkonnas tuleb kasuks
B-kategooria juhiluba on eeliseks
Sinu peamised tööülesanded:
Suhtlemine reisihuviliste ja klientidega
Suhete hoidmine reisibüroodega
Reiside soovitamine, pakkumine ja broneerimine
Broneerimissüsteemide kasutamine (väljaõpe meie poolt)
Ole usaldusväärne reisikonsultant ja tugi klientidele ning partneritele kogu reisi vältel
Pakume Sulle:
Stabiilset töökohta rahvusvahelise kogemusega ettevõttes
Tugevat ja reisisõbralikku meeskonda, kus reisimine on elu osa
Põhipalka alates 1200 € bruto + tulemuspõhine boonus
Tasustatud vaba päeva sünnipäeval
Paindlikkust, arenguvõimalusi ja sõbralikku töökeskkonda
Täielikku sotsiaalset garantiid ning töölepingut vastavalt Eesti seadustele
Vanus ei ole takistuseks oluline on Sinu suhtumine, tahe õppida ja areneda!
Kui tunned, et see töö sobiks Sulle, siis kandideeri juba täna!
Võtame ühendust vaid järgmisesse vooru pääsenud kandidaatidega.

We Are Looking for a Travel Consultant
About Us:
Interlux Travel is an international tour operator with over 10 years of experience organizing quality and in-demand trips in the Baltics and beyond. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a positive, communicative, and proactive colleague to join our professional team.
What We Expect From You:
Fluency in Estonian and Russian (spoken and written)
Openness to new challenges and a willingness to learn
A positive mindset, ability to react quickly, and problem-solving attitude
Confidence using a computer and communicating via email and phone
Experience in tourism, sales, or customer service is a strong advantage
Category B driver's license (preferred)
Your Main Responsibilities:
Communicate with clients interested in traveling
Maintain relationships with travel agencies
Recommend, offer, and book trips while responding to client inquiries
Work with reservation systems (we will train you!)
Be a reliable travel advisor and support for clients and partners from start to finish
What We Offer:
A stable job in a company with international experience
An energetic team where traveling is a way of life
Salary starting from €1200 gross + performance-based bonuses
Paid day off on your birthday
Flexibility, opportunities for growth, and a friendly work environment
Full social guarantees and a contract in accordance with Estonian law
Age is not a barrier your attitude, drive, and willingness to grow are what matter most!
If you feel this could be your next step apply today!
We will contact selected candidates for the next stage of the hiring process.

1468215.title: Head of Internal Audit
1468215.description:
We are seeking a
Head of Internal Audit
who will play a key role within IPF Digital, leading and executing the internal audit strategy across all markets. This role will be responsible for ensuring effective risk management, governance, and control processes, while providing independent assurance and actionable insight to IPF Digital management and the Group Head of Internal Audit. Our ideal candidate will strengthen the organisations ability to manage risks, comply with regulatory requirements, and continuously improve its operations in line with the IPF Digital business strategy.
About IPF Digital (in a nutshell)
IPF Digital provides fast, flexible, and convenient credit solutions under the Creditea and Credit24 brands to retail customers in Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Mexico, Australia, and the Czech Republic.
Our solutions are designed to be mobile-first with fully digital processes. The technology stack includes a native mobile APP, digital web journeys, and micro-services infrastructure. We offer different type of loan product like instalment loan, credit line, and buy-now-pay-later.
Our customers might require money for something vital, such as paying an unexpected bill or coping with day-to-day expenses. Or they may be looking for help to carry out home improvements, buy a car, or start a business.
Whatever they need, we offer innovative financial services that are respectful, responsible, and straightforward.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and deliver the internal audit plan
, ensuring coverage of key business risks, including those specific to the E-Money Institution (EMI) in Estonia with Group Internal Audit methodology and regulatory expectations.
Provide independent assurance on governance
, risk management, and controls, with focus on EMI compliance and Estonian regulator (Finantsinspektsioon) requirements.
Monitor e-money licence obligations
, including safeguarding of funds, capital adequacy, AML controls, and operational resilience.
Engage with senior stakeholders
across IPF Digital and the wider Group to align on risks and regulatory priorities.
Report and liaise with regulators
, ensuring timely communication of audit findings, risk assessments, and remediation progress.
Manage audit resources and third-party providers
, ensuring efficient delivery of the audit plan and adherence to quality standards.
Advise leadership
with insights on internal controls, governance, and compliance processes.
Promote a culture of risk awareness and integrity
, embedding compliance responsibilities across the business.
Stay current on laws, regulations, and best practices
to drive continuous improvement and best-in-class audit delivery.
Qualifications, skills and experience:
Degree-level education with
professional accounting qualification
(ACA, ACCA, CIMA) or equivalent;
CIA/CMIIA certification
desirable.
7+ years experience
in risk-based internal auditing within complex, multinational environments, with background in accounting, financial reporting, or business process management.
Strong knowledge of
internal audit, governance, risk, and control frameworks
, plus understanding of financial products and digital lending models (desirable).
Proven ability to
manage senior stakeholders
and collaborate across geographically dispersed teams.
Excellent
communication, report-writing, and presentation skills
, credible with senior leaders.
Strong
analytical and problem-solving abilities
, able to manage multiple complex projects under pressure.
Skilled in
coaching and mentoring
to support team development.
Fluent in English; proficient in
Microsoft Office
; willing to travel as needed.
What we can offer you:
Competitive salary;
Annual bonus;
Additional employer health insurance and/or sports compensation (Stebby);
Anonymous mental health counseling service "Võõras Sõber";
Partial remote work opportunity;
Modern office in Ülemiste City;
Good work assets;
Parking near the office;
Internal and external training opportunities;
Career and development opportunities;
Fun company and team events - we even celebrate Halloween!
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment;
Chance to make a real impact on the growth and success of the company.
You will enjoy working at IPF Digital if you value a truly international work environment where you can take responsibility for your tasks; you value a friendly and open work culture and good teamwork.
Here's how our team describes our culture:
"The culture at IPFD is driven by our shared values. People are put first; we accept differences and encourage individuality. Due to our flat business structure, we enjoy collaborating. Although recognition is highly valued, failure is also accepted. Enjoying some good times together is also highly encouraged!"
Sounds good? :) Then Please Apply, and let's meet up. ;)

1475112.title: Administrative Assistant / Administratiivosakonna assistent
1475112.description:
Administrative Assistant (Administrative and Accounting Affairs):
The Embassy of Japan in Estonia seeks a full-time staff for the position of Administrative Assistant including the secretary works.
1.   Estimated Starting Date:
March-April 2026
2.   Duties for this position include:
Assisting with accounting operation.
Coordinating with vendors, which may involve negotiation.
Assisting with reception operations.
Managing schedule.
Supervising other local staff and providing guidance as needed.
Assisting diplomats with their daily life in Estonia.
Collecting information, conducting research, translating and preparing documents in English.
Please note: The specific duties outlined above may be subject to adjustment or evolution after the successful candidate joins us, based on their qualifications and the evolving needs of the mission.
3.   Working hours:
Monday to Friday, 9:00 am 5:00 pm with a possibility of overtime work. 1 hour of lunch time is included.
4.   Additional information:
A competitive salary will be offered, commensurate with the successful candidate's experience and qualifications. Employees are entitled to annual leave, sick leave, and public holidays (in addition to Estonian public holidays, some Japanese holidays are also observed). The specific terms and conditions of remuneration and benefits will be discussed during the interview.
5.   Requirements:
Estonian citizenship or Residence permit for employment in Estonia.
Good mental and physical health.
Fluency in Estonian and English. *While not strictly mandatory, candidates with Japanese language proficiency (JLPT N2 level or higher) will be given strong preference.
Proficiency in computer skills, including Microsoft Word and Excel, etc.
A university degree.
Excellent administrative, planning and organizational skills.
Excellent research and analytical skills.
6.   Application Deadline: By January 23, 2026
Please note: Following document screening, interviews and practical tests (e.g., telephone handling) will be conducted.
7.   How to Apply:
Interested applicants are requested to submit their
CV and a cover letter, both in English
to the Embassy via email (
saiyou@ti.mofa.go.jp
).
Please ensure your CV includes the following essential details: your full name, date of birth, nationality, address, comprehensive contact details (including mobile phone number and email address), educational background, and work experience.
Please be assured that all personal information provided will be treated with confidentiality and will only be used internally by the Embassy for the purpose of this recruitment process. It will not be disclosed to any third parties.
Following an initial document screening, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.
Embassy of Japan in Estonia
Harju 6, 15069 Tallinn
E-mail: saiyou@ti.mofa.go.jp

Töötasu ja hüvitiste täpsemaid tingimusi arutatakse intervjuu käigus.
5.   Nõuded kandideerimiseks
:
Eesti kodakondsus või elamisluba töötamiseks;
hea füüsiline ja vaimne tervis;
väga hea eesti ja inglise keele oskus. Jaapani keele oskus on soovitatav. Kuigi jaapani keele oskuks ei ole rangelt kohustuslik, eelistatakse kandidaate, kes valdavad jaapani keelt (JLPT N2 tase või kõrgem).
arvutikasutamise oskus (Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel jm);
kõrgharidus;
suurepärased haldus-, planeerimis- ja organiseerimisoskused;
suurepärased uurimis- ja analüüsioskused.
6.   Kandideerimise tähtaeg : 23. jaanuar 2026
Pärast dokumentidega tutvumist kutsutakse väljavalitud kandidaadid intervjuule ja palutakse täita mõned praktilised ülesanded.
7.   Kuidas kandideerida
Huvilistel palume saata nii oma
CV
kui ka
kaaskiri ingliskeelsena
saatkonnale e-posti teel (
saiyou@ti.mofa.go.jp
).
CV peab sisaldama järgimisi olulisi andmeid: täisnimi, sünniaeg, aadress, kontaktinfo (mobiiltelefoni number ja e-posti aadress), kodakondsus, hariduslik taust ja töökogemused.
Kinnitame, et kõiki esitatud isikuandmeid käsitletakse konfidentsiaalselt ja kasutatakse ainult asutusesiseselt käesoleva värbamisprotsessi eesmärgil. Neid ei avaldata kolmandatele osapooltele.
Ühendust võetakse ainult esmase valiku läbinud kandidaatidega, et kutsuda nad tööintervjuule.
Jaapani Suursaatkond
Harju 6, 15069 Tallinn

skills.
With us, you can experience:

A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role;

" Join our team and...
be a part of an international team of professionals who are jointly delivering challenging projects. Join our team if you feel like taking the challenge and would want to work in a team with dedicated and supportive colleagues, who uphold the best industry practices in both the Baltics and Sweden."
Karin Ange, your future leader

1477592.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist
1477592.description:
What we expect from you::
Proven experience in recruitment within iGaming, IT, fintech, digital entertainment, or technical agencies
Demonstrated capability in hiring roles such as software engineering, product, QA, data, risk, compliance, fraud, or operations
Strong expertise in international sourcing and engaging talent across multiple markets
Proficiency in LinkedIn Recruiter, ATS platforms, Boolean search, and modern search tools
Skilled in structured interviews and evidence-based candidate assessment
Ability to manage multiple vacancies with high accuracy and strong organisational discipline
Clear, timely, and professional communication with candidates and stakeholders
Comfort operating in fast-paced and dynamic environments
Strong prioritisation, documentation habits, and process reliability

About the role::
We are seeking a highly skilled
Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist
to manage end-to-end hiring for technical, operational, and specialist positions. The position focuses on precise execution of the hiring process, global sourcing of scarce talent, and the application of structured assessment methods. You will work closely with hiring managers, ensure full process compliance, and contribute to onboarding implementation and employer-branding activities that strengthen our market presence.
What's in it for you:
Flat structure with minimal bureaucracy
Opportunity to influence hiring quality and market reach
Direct contribution to recruitment performance and talent acquisition capability
Chance to support the growth of our brand
Clear impact on team development and organisational outcomes
What you will do:
Manage the full recruitment cycle for marketing, technical, product and operational roles.
Conduct structured intake discussions and drive efficient screening, interviewing, and offer processes.
Source talent internationally through targeted outreach, talent mapping, Boolean search, and professional networks.
Apply structured interviewing methods and provide evidence-based assessments to hiring managers.
Ensure accurate documentation, process compliance, and timely communication with candidates and stakeholders.
Support onboarding implementation and contribute to smooth offboarding processes where relevant.
Collaborate on employer-branding initiatives to strengthen market visibility and candidate engagement.

What we offer::
A no bureaucracy work environment
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours
Hybrid work setup; brand-new office in Ülemiste City
Diverse and inclusive workplace
Sports compensation via Stebby
28 calendar days of annual leave
Complimentary company merchandise

1477644.title: Baltics IT Business Analyst
1477644.description:
Our requirements:
Higher Education in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience in business and systems analysis, design, and documentation.
Experience in stakeholders' engagement and representation.
Excellent organizational skills, attention to details.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to communicate in a language understandable to business, technical team and customers. Ability to work independently and within the cross-functional and business units' teams. Knowledge of analysis related tools, frameworks, standard modeling languages, e.g., BPML, UML.
Excellent English knowledge (oral and written).
Nice to have (competitive advantages):
Understanding of system integration concepts and how data moves between systems.
Familiarity with web services
Awareness of data exchange protocols such as FTP/SFTP, message queues, etc.
Ability to interpret or validate data in JSON, XML, or CSV formats.
Basic understanding of data modeling.
Ability to interpret or write simple data extract queries
General awareness of cloud platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Azure) and their role in modern IT ecosystems.

Your responsibilities:
1.  Business & Technical Analysis
Work with stakeholders to define and document clear business case, needs and problems, business solution, functional and non-functional requirements, and success metrics.
Translate requirements into IT solutionʼs technical specifications.
Analyze, evaluate and document IT solutions, systems and integrations to support IT
enhancements and new implementations.
Assess, analyze, develop and document process models (e.g., BPMN) to support process digital transformation and/or IT optimization.
Define User Acceptance Testing (UAT) scenarios, acceptance criteria, and traceability to
requirements, support UAT.
2.  Community Engagement
Represent DPD Baltics interests, participate in community initiatives.
3.  User Support & Training
Prepare and deliver clear documentation, presentations, and training materials to ensure effective knowledge transfer to IT support teams, business users, and other stakeholders.
4.  Collaboration
Facilitate workshops and requirement-gathering sessions with stakeholders.
Contribute to project planning, estimation, and prioritisation.
Support solution design, testing, and deployment phases.
Collaborate with project managers, architects, business and technical service owners, and 3rd party services providers to ensure business requirements are correctly implemented.
5.  Continuous Improvement
Identify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and digital transformation.
Stay informed about emerging technologies, logistics innovations, and business analysis trends.
Promote data-driven decision making.
Continuous improvement of business analysis service quality and KPIʼs

Company offers:
Gain international working experience and learn from the best in Geopost.
Flexible working environment and a comprehensive benefits package.
Annual bonus.
Additional benefits like a monthly Stebby allowance, additional mental health benefits, 100% sickness leave payment for the first 3 days, additional holiday days, and more.
Personal mentor to support you.
Onboarding and training plan.

1477695.title: IT Security Engineer
1477695.description:
What you need to succeed in the role::
Relevant university degree or an excellent reason for not having one
Security or related background, with hands-on experience in cybersecurity management and operations tools
Strong IT skills, including knowledge of hardware, software, networks, and cloud services
Knowledge of incident response, handling methodologies, and cybersecurity principles
Readiness to solve problems quickly while always looking for ways to improve the systems
You can work independently, take responsibility, and perform well despite ambiguity or constant changes. You are good at communication, fluent in English, comfortable interacting with business and technology, and have excellent analytical skills.

What will be your challenge in the role::
We are looking for
IT Security Engineer
To join our team in Tallinn
What will be your challenge in the role:
You will join the team of security specialists and enthusiasts to work with international stakeholders to resolve cybersecurity operations challenges and vulnerability compliance. You will navigate the SecOps landscape in our global company, be a responsible engineer for at least one of the cybersecurity defence capabilities, and successfully participate in a rotating security analyst role. Your tasks will include the following:
Build, configure, test, and maintain dedicated cyber defence systems
Make sense of the influx of information through the myriad data sources
Strive for automation of repeatable tasks

1468494.title: Elektriinsener
1468494.description:
Valmis uueks väljakutseks?:
Pakume võimalust ühineda meie ettevõtte ärisuunaga elektrisüsteemide tehnoloogialahenduste alal ning töötada kaasaegses töökeskkonnas koos oma ala spetsialistidega.
Otsime inseneri elektrisüsteemide projekteerimise, seadistuse ja korrashoiu alal elektripaigaldistele kuni 330kV. Töö sisaldab projekteerimist ja tegevusi kliendi töömaal ning hõlmab koostööd teiste inseneride ja projektijuhtidega.
Ootame kandideerima nii kogenud spetsialiste kui ka noori arenemissooviga insenere.

Tööülesanded:
Elektrisüsteemide projekteerimine, seadistamine ja korrashoid.
Tehniliste probleemide lahendus ning uute lahenduste ja parendustegevuste pakkumine koostöös meeskonnaga.
Ohutuse ja kvaliteedi tagamine sooritatavatel töödel.
Tööde koordineerimine ja kommunikatsioon klientide, allhankijate, kohalike elektrivõrkude juhtimiskeskuste ja teiste asjaosalistega.

Ootused kandidaadile:
Elektriinsener vastavalt EstQF/EQF nõuetele, vähemalt tase 6.
Projekteerimistarkvara (Eplan, E3, AutoCad vm) valdamine.
Hea eesti ja inglise keele oskus.
Meeskonnatöö oskus ja kohusetunne.
Valmisolek töötada rahvusvahelises ja multikultuurses töökeskkonnas.
Kasuks tuleb tehnoloogiste paigaldiste juht- ja arvutisüsteemide tundmine.

Ettevõttest:
Hitachi Energy on globaalselt esindatud rohkem 90 riigis ja töötajaid on üle 50 000. Teenindame kliente energeetika-, tööstus- ja transpordisektoris uuenduslike lahenduste ja teenustega kogu väärtusahela ulatuses. Koos klientide ja partneritega oleme tehnoloogiate teerajajad ja võimaldame digitaalset ümberkujundamist süsinikuneutraalse tuleviku suunas.
Pakume konkurentsivõimelist töötasu, paindliku töökorraldust, mitmekülgset motivatsioonipaketti, võimalusi pidevaks arenguks ning töökeskkonda, kus tunnete end toetatuna ja väärtustatuna. Täpsematest hüvedest räägime värbamisprotsessi käigus.
Rohkem infot meie tegemiste kohta leiate meie kodulehelt www.hitachienergy.com

1470674.title: Senior QA Engineer
1470674.description:
Senior QA Engineer:
About Playtech
Founded in 1999, the company has a premium listing on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange and is focused on regulated and regulating markets across its B2B business. By leveraging its proprietary technology, Playtech delivers innovative products and services to ensure a safe, engaging and entertaining gaming experience.
As the gaming industry's leading technology company, it combines business intelligence-driven software, services, content, and platform technology to drive excellence and innovation across the sector. Read more about who we are and what we do here: www.playtechpeople.com and www.playtech.com
Here at Playtech, we genuinely believe that people are our biggest asset. Diverse thoughts, experiences, and individual characteristics enrich our work environment and lead to better business decisions. Embracing differences and maintaining transparency in our processes is the core of Playtech's overall commitment to responsible business practices.
Ready to level up your career?
Playtechs
Casino unit
is looking for a proactive
Senior
QA Engineer
with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Your influential mission. You will...
Design and configure complex environments and applications, and create strategic test plans
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements and influence quality standards
Use advanced SQL, Java, and Linux tools in your daily work
Lead participation in an agile software development life cycle, ensuring quality practices
Analyze documentation and drive clarity for testing objectives
Create advanced test cases and contribute to automation frameworks, guiding improvements
Manage and optimize test environments for scalability and reliability
Leverage automated tests and proactively identify gaps
Ensure product quality at scale through rigorous testing and strategic feedback
Track and report project status, providing actionable insights
Present demos and share recommendations to stakeholders
Work on global-scale, high-complexity products
Provide feedback and drive continuous improvement for product and processes
Mentor team members, fostering growth and best practices in QA
Components for success. You...
Bring a deep technical foundation and extensive hands-on experience
Demonstrate advanced SQL skills for complex data analysis and validation
Apply expert-level Linux knowledge in day-to-day tasks and troubleshooting
Possess strong mentoring abilities, strategic thinking, and exceptional self-management skills
Have a comprehensive understanding of software testing principles and development processes
Maintain a collaborative, solution-focused, and positive mindset
Identify issues and investigate their root causes with precision and efficiency
Approach technical challenges with creativity, flexibility, and scalability in mind
Think abstractly to anticipate edge cases, system behaviors, and architectural impacts
Prioritize issues based on severity, impact, and business risk
Communicate clearly and confidently in both spoken and written English
You'll get extra points for...
Proficiency in at least one programming language (Java preferred)
Thrive in a culture that values...
Empowerment, support and mentoring. Initiative-taking, positive and confident approach at the workplace.
Global scope and inclusive working environment.
Constant learning and development opportunities.
Active lifestyle and mental well-being.
CASINO UNIT
Creating Playtechs flagship products is in our DNA. Our successful gaming ecosystems reach millions of players around the globe and win prestigious industry awards. We are striving to explore and utilize new technologies on a regular basis.
Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

Tehniline kõrgharidus, automaatika, ehituse, energeetika, keskkonnaehituse või soojusenergeetika valdkonnas
Väga hea suhtlemisoskus. Avatud suhtlemine, info jagamine, koostöö, oskus juhtida infot eri osapoolte vahel. Koordineerimine ja koostöö juhtimine ettevõtte erinevate üksuste vahel.
Tulemusele orienteeritus. Väga selge arusaam projekti lõpptulemusest ja selle selgitamine projektis osalejatele.
Väga hea eesti ja inglise keele suuline ja kirjalik oskus.
Väga hea arvuti kasutamise oskus projektijuhtimise tarkvara (MS Project) ja/või excel professionaalsel tasemel. Joonestusprogramm kasutamise oskus tuleb kasuks.
B-kategooria autojuhi load.

Peamised tööülesanded:
Projektide (eel)planeerimine ja teostamine
. Klientide nõustamine projekti planeerimisel. Eelarve koostamine ja selle täitmise jälgimine. Projekti tarnete, tegevus- ja ajakava lähtudes kliendiga sõlmitud lepingust. Projekti tiimi moodustamine ja kokkulepped. Suhtluse ja kommunikatsiooni koordineerimine projekti elluviimise ajal. Dokumentatsiooni nõuetekohane koostamine, kättesaadavus, süsteem ja korrashoid. Teostab projekti elluviimisejärgse analüüsi ja teeb parendusettepanekud.
Suhtlemine tarnijatega ja allhankijatega.
Planeerib projektis ettenähtud tööd, korraldab hankekonkursid ja tellib allhanked järgides ettevõtte sisemist korda ja sõlmib vajadusel lepingu. Teostab kontrolli alltöövõtjate ja tarnijate tegevuse üle. Korraldab seadmete ja materjalide ostmise ettevõttes kehtestatud protseduuri järgides. Kontrollib vajadusel toodete vastavust tellimusele, kinnitab ostuarved. Korraldab auditikohustuslike seadmete ja/või rajatiste projektide kooskõlastamise ja kasutuselevõtule eelnevad auditid.
Projekti jälgimine garantiiajal.
Korraldab projekti lisa- ja remonditöid. Korraldab kliendi reklamatsioonide lahendamist projekti/objekti garantiiajal.

* Motiveeriv tasupakett, mis sisaldab lisaks põhipalgale ka tulemustasu. Täpne pakkumine selgub läbirääkimiste käigus.
* Sinu valikul täiendav ravikindlustus, mis sisaldab erinevaid teenuseid (nt ambulatoorne eriarstiabi, haiglaraviteenused, eridiagnostika, vaimse tervise teenused, taastusravi, hambaravi, ennetavad terviseuuringud) või sporditoetus 100 eur/kvartal.

* Lugupidav ja palju iseseisvust andev töökultuur

Tööülesannete kirjeldus:

Tagada projektide kasumlikkus ja kvaliteet.
Koostöös haldurite ja korteriühistute juhatustega leida sobivaimad tehnilised lahendused.
Arendada välja tööprotsessid ja standardid, mis loovad aluse tulevasele ehitusmeeskonnale.

Toetavat ja koostöist tiimi, kus haldurid ja müügijuht aitavad projektidele hoogu anda.
Pikaajalist koostööd ja perspektiivi juhtida tulevikus oma meeskonda.
